pli-tv-pvr2.1:0.4.eng: Questions and answers on the nuns’ Pātimokkha rules and their analysis

pli-tv-pvr2.1:0.5.eng: The chapter on offenses entailing expulsion

pli-tv-pvr2.1:1.1.pli: Yaṃ tena bhagavatā jānatā passatā arahatā sammāsambuddhena bhikkhunīnaṃ pañcamaṃ pārājikaṃ kattha paññattaṃ?
pli-tv-pvr2.1:1.1.eng: “The nuns’ fifth offense entailing expulsion was laid down by the Buddha who knows and sees, the Perfected One, the fully Awakened One. Where was it laid down?

pli-tv-pvr2.1:1.4.eng: Is there a rule, an addition to the rule, an unprompted rule?

pli-tv-pvr2.1:1.5.eng: Is it a rule that applies everywhere or in a particular place?

pli-tv-pvr2.1:1.6.eng: Is it a rule that the monks and nuns have in common or not in common?

pli-tv-pvr2.1:1.7.eng: Is it a rule for one Sangha or for both?

pli-tv-pvr2.1:1.8.eng: In which of the four ways of reciting the Monastic Code is it contained and included?

pli-tv-pvr2.1:1.9.eng: In which recitation is it included?

pli-tv-pvr2.1:1.10.eng: To which of the four kinds of failure does it belong?

pli-tv-pvr2.1:1.11.eng: To which of the seven classes of offenses does it belong?

pli-tv-pvr2.1:1.12.eng: Through how many of the six kinds of originations of offenses does it originate?

pli-tv-pvr2.1:1.13.eng: To which of the four kinds of legal issues does it belong?

pli-tv-pvr2.1:1.14.eng: Through how many of the seven principles for settling legal issues is it settled?

pli-tv-pvr2.1:1.15.eng: What is the Monastic Law there?

pli-tv-pvr2.1:1.16.eng: What is concerned with the Monastic Law there?

pli-tv-pvr2.1:1.17.eng: What is the Monastic Code there?

pli-tv-pvr2.1:1.18.eng: What is concerned with the Monastic Code there?

pli-tv-pvr2.1:1.22.pli: Kati atthavase paṭicca bhagavatā bhikkhunīnaṃ pañcamaṃ pārājikaṃ paññattaṃ?
pli-tv-pvr2.1:1.22.eng: For how many reasons did the Buddha lay down the nun’s fifth offense entailing expulsion?

pli-tv-pvr2.1:2.1.pli: Yaṃ tena bhagavatā jānatā passatā arahatā sammāsambuddhena bhikkhunīnaṃ pañcamaṃ pārājikaṃ kattha paññattanti?
pli-tv-pvr2.1:2.1.eng: “The nuns’ fifth offense entailing expulsion was laid down by the Buddha who knows and sees, the Perfected One, the fully Awakened One. Where was it laid down?”

pli-tv-pvr2.1:2.6.pli: Sundarīnandā bhikkhunī avassutā avassutassa purisapuggalassa kāyasaṃsaggaṃ sādiyi, tasmiṃ vatthusmiṃ.
pli-tv-pvr2.1:2.6.eng: The lustful nun Sundarīnandā consenting to a lustful man making physical contact with her.

pli-tv-pvr2.1:2.7.eng: “Is there a rule, an addition to the rule, an unprompted rule?”

pli-tv-pvr2.1:2.9.eng: There is no addition to the rule. There is no unprompted rule.

pli-tv-pvr2.1:2.10.eng: “Is it a rule that applies everywhere or in a particular place?”

pli-tv-pvr2.1:2.12.eng: “Is it a rule that the monks and nuns have in common or not in common?”

pli-tv-pvr2.1:2.14.eng: “Is it a rule for one Sangha or for both?”

pli-tv-pvr2.1:2.16.eng: “In which of the four ways of reciting the Monastic Code is it contained and included?”

pli-tv-pvr2.1:2.17.comm: Sp 5.2: Nidānogadhanti “yassa siyā āpatti so āvikareyyā”ti ettha sabbāpattīnaṁ anupaviṭṭhattā nidānogadhaṁ; nidāne anupaviṭṭhanti attho, “Nidānogadha: it is contained in the introduction because of the entry here of all offenses: ‘Anyone who has committed an offense should reveal it.’ The meaning is they are entered in the introduction.”

pli-tv-pvr2.1:2.20.eng: “To which of the four kinds of failure does it belong?”

pli-tv-pvr2.1:2.22.eng: “To which of the seven classes of offenses does it belong?”

pli-tv-pvr2.1:2.23.eng: The class of offenses entailing expulsion.

pli-tv-pvr2.1:2.24.eng: “Through how many of the six kinds of originations of offenses does it originate?”

pli-tv-pvr2.1:2.26.pli: kāyato ca cittato ca samuṭṭhāti, na vācato.
pli-tv-pvr2.1:2.26.eng: from body and mind, not from speech.

pli-tv-pvr2.1:2.27.eng: “To which of the four kinds of legal issues does it belong?”

pli-tv-pvr2.1:2.28.eng: Legal issues arising from an offense.

pli-tv-pvr2.1:2.29.eng: “Through how many of the seven principles for settling legal issues is it settled?”

pli-tv-pvr2.1:2.31.eng: by resolution face-to-face and by acting according to what has been admitted.

pli-tv-pvr2.1:2.32.pli: Ko tattha vinayo, ko tattha abhivinayoti?
pli-tv-pvr2.1:2.32.eng: “What is the Monastic Law there? What is concerned with the Monastic Law there?”

pli-tv-pvr2.1:2.33.eng: The rule is the Monastic Law. Its analysis is concerned with the Monastic Law.

pli-tv-pvr2.1:2.34.pli: Kiṃ tattha pātimokkhaṃ, kiṃ tattha adhipātimokkhanti?
pli-tv-pvr2.1:2.34.eng: “What is the Monastic Code there? What is concerned with the Monastic Code there?”

pli-tv-pvr2.1:2.35.eng: The rule is the Monastic Code. Its analysis is concerned with the Monastic Code.

pli-tv-pvr2.1:2.41.pli: “Na evarūpaṃ karissāmī”ti yāvajīvaṃ āpāṇakoṭikaṃ samādāya sikkhati sikkhāpadesu.
pli-tv-pvr2.1:2.41.eng: Thinking, “I won’t do such a thing,” one undertakes to train in the training rules for life.

pli-tv-pvr2.1:2.42.pli: Kati atthavase paṭicca bhagavatā bhikkhunīnaṃ pañcamaṃ pārājikaṃ paññattanti?
pli-tv-pvr2.1:2.42.eng: “For how many reasons did the Buddha lay down the nun’s fifth offense entailing expulsion?”

pli-tv-pvr2.1:2.43.pli: Dasa atthavase paṭicca bhagavatā bhikkhunīnaṃ pañcamaṃ pārājikaṃ paññattaṃ—
pli-tv-pvr2.1:2.43.eng: He laid it down for the following ten reasons:

pli-tv-pvr2.1:2.44.pli: saṅghasuṭṭhutāya, saṅghaphāsutāya, dummaṅkūnaṃ bhikkhunīnaṃ niggahāya, pesalānaṃ bhikkhunīnaṃ phāsuvihārāya, diṭṭhadhammikānaṃ āsavānaṃ saṃvarāya, samparāyikānaṃ āsavānaṃ paṭighātāya, appasannānaṃ pasādāya, pasannānaṃ bhiyyobhāvāya, saddhammaṭṭhitiyā, vinayānuggahāya.
pli-tv-pvr2.1:2.44.eng: for the well-being of the Sangha, for the comfort of the Sangha, for the restraint of bad nuns, for the ease of good nuns, for the restraint of the corruptions relating to the present life, for the restraint of the corruptions relating to future lives, to give rise to confidence in those without it, to increase the confidence of those who have it, for the longevity of the true Teaching, and for supporting the training.

pli-tv-pvr2.1:2.46.eng: They are the trainees and the good ordinary people.

pli-tv-pvr2.1:2.54.eng: It was the pronouncement of the Buddha, the Perfected One, the fully Awakened One.

pli-tv-pvr2.1:3.4.eng: These were in India, the land named after the glorious rose apple.

pli-tv-pvr2.1:4.3.eng: And the wise one named Bhadda:

pli-tv-pvr2.1:5.1.eng: These mighty beings of great wisdom,

pli-tv-pvr2.1:5.3.eng: They taught the Collection on Monastic Law,

pli-tv-pvr2.1:6.1.eng: And the five Collections of Discourses,

pli-tv-pvr2.1:6.2.eng: And the seven works of philosophy;

pli-tv-pvr2.1:7.2.eng: And the senior monk named Dīgha;

pli-tv-pvr2.1:8.2.eng: And the senior monk Nāga, Buddharakkhita;

pli-tv-pvr2.1:8.3.eng: And the discerning senior monk Tissa,

pli-tv-pvr2.1:8.4.eng: And the wise senior monk Deva.

pli-tv-pvr2.1:10.3.eng: His student Khema of great wisdom,

pli-tv-pvr2.1:10.4.eng: A master of the three Collections.

pli-tv-pvr2.1:11.1.eng: Like the king of the stars on the island,

pli-tv-pvr2.1:11.2.eng: He outshone others in his wisdom;

pli-tv-pvr2.1:13.4.eng: Skilled in the tradition of the true Teaching.

pli-tv-pvr2.1:14.3.eng: And the discerning senior monk Tissa,

pli-tv-pvr2.1:16.3.eng: And the discerning senior monk Tissa,

pli-tv-pvr2.1:16.4.eng: Skilled in the tradition of the true Teaching.

pli-tv-pvr2.1:17.3.eng: And the discerning senior monk Siva,

pli-tv-pvr2.1:17.4.eng: Skilled in the entire Monastic Law—

pli-tv-pvr2.1:18.1.eng: These mighty beings of great wisdom,

pli-tv-pvr2.1:18.2.eng: Knowers of the Monastic Law and skilled in the path;

pli-tv-pvr2.1:18.3.eng: Proclaimed the Collection of Monastic Law,

pli-tv-pvr2.1:18.4.eng: On the island of Sri Lanka.”

pli-tv-pvr2.1:19.1.pli: Yaṃ tena bhagavatā jānatā passatā arahatā sammāsambuddhena bhikkhunīnaṃ chaṭṭhaṃ pārājikaṃ kattha paññattanti?
pli-tv-pvr2.1:19.1.eng: “The nuns’ sixth offense entailing expulsion was laid down by the Buddha who knows and sees, the Perfected One, the fully Awakened One. Where was it laid down?”

pli-tv-pvr2.1:19.6.pli: Thullanandā bhikkhunī jānaṃ pārājikaṃ dhammaṃ ajjhāpannaṃ bhikkhuniṃ nevattanā paṭicodesi na gaṇassa ārocesi, tasmiṃ vatthusmiṃ.
pli-tv-pvr2.1:19.6.eng: The nun Thullanandā, knowing that a nun had committed an offense entailing expulsion, neither confronting her herself nor telling the community.

pli-tv-pvr2.1:19.8.eng: Of the six kinds of originations of offenses, it originates in one way:

pli-tv-pvr2.1:19.9.pli: kāyato ca vācato ca cittato ca samuṭṭhāti …pe….

pli-tv-pvr2.1:20.1.eng: “There is the nun’s seventh offense entailing expulsion. Where was it laid down?”

pli-tv-pvr2.1:20.6.pli: Thullanandā bhikkhunī samaggena saṅghena ukkhittaṃ ariṭṭhaṃ bhikkhuṃ gaddhabādhipubbaṃ anuvatti, tasmiṃ vatthusmiṃ.
pli-tv-pvr2.1:20.6.eng: The nun Thullanandā taking sides with the monk Ariṭṭha, an ex-vulture-killer, who had been ejected by a unanimous Sangha.

pli-tv-pvr2.1:20.8.eng: Of the six kinds of originations of offenses, it originates in one way:

pli-tv-pvr2.1:21.1.eng: “There is the nun’s eighth offense entailing expulsion. Where was it laid down?”

pli-tv-pvr2.1:21.4.eng: The nuns from the group of six.

pli-tv-pvr2.1:21.6.pli: Chabbaggiyā bhikkhuniyo aṭṭhamaṃ vatthuṃ paripūresuṃ, tasmiṃ vatthusmiṃ.
pli-tv-pvr2.1:21.6.eng: The nuns from the group of six fulfilling the eight parts.

pli-tv-pvr2.1:21.8.eng: Of the six kinds of originations of offenses, it originates in one way:

pli-tv-pvr2.1:22.1.eng: The eight offenses entailing expulsion are finished.

pli-tv-pvr2.1:24.6.eng: The definitive grounds for cutting off.”

pli-tv-pvr2.1:25.0.eng: 2. The chapter on offenses entailing suspension

pli-tv-pvr2.1:25.1.pli: Yaṃ tena bhagavatā jānatā passatā arahatā sammāsambuddhena ussayavādikāya bhikkhuniyā aḍḍaṃ karontiyā saṅghādiseso kattha paññatto?
pli-tv-pvr2.1:25.1.eng: “The offense entailing suspension for a litigious nun initiating a lawsuit was laid down by the Buddha who knows and sees, the Perfected One, the fully Awakened One. Where was it laid down?

pli-tv-pvr2.1:26.1.pli: Yaṃ tena bhagavatā jānatā passatā arahatā sammāsambuddhena ussayavādikāya bhikkhuniyā aḍḍaṃ karontiyā saṅghādiseso kattha paññattoti?
pli-tv-pvr2.1:26.1.eng: “The offense entailing suspension for a litigious nun initiating a lawsuit was laid down by the Buddha who knows and sees, the Perfected One, the fully Awakened One. Where was it laid down?”

pli-tv-pvr2.1:26.6.pli: Thullanandā bhikkhunī ussayavādikā vihari, tasmiṃ vatthusmiṃ.
pli-tv-pvr2.1:26.6.eng: The nun Thullanandā taking legal action.

pli-tv-pvr2.1:26.7.eng: “Is there a rule, an addition to the rule, an unprompted rule?”

pli-tv-pvr2.1:26.9.eng: There is no addition to the rule. There is no unprompted rule.

pli-tv-pvr2.1:26.10.eng: “Is it a rule that applies everywhere or in a particular place?”

pli-tv-pvr2.1:26.12.eng: “Is it a rule that the monks and nuns have in common or not in common?”

pli-tv-pvr2.1:26.14.eng: “Is it a rule for one Sangha or for both?”

pli-tv-pvr2.1:26.16.eng: “In which of the four ways of reciting the Monastic Code is it contained and included?”

pli-tv-pvr2.1:26.20.eng: “To which of the four kinds of failure does it belong?”

pli-tv-pvr2.1:26.22.eng: “To which of the seven classes of offenses does it belong?”

pli-tv-pvr2.1:26.23.eng: The class of offenses entailing suspension.

pli-tv-pvr2.1:26.24.eng: “Through how many of the six kinds of originations of offenses does it originate?”

pli-tv-pvr2.1:26.26.pli: siyā kāyato ca vācato ca samuṭṭhāti, na cittato;
pli-tv-pvr2.1:26.26.eng: from body and speech, not from mind; or

pli-tv-pvr2.1:26.27.pli: siyā kāyato ca vācato ca cittato ca samuṭṭhāti …pe…

pli-tv-pvr2.1:27.4.eng: These were in India, the land named after the glorious rose apple.

pli-tv-pvr2.1:29.1.eng: These mighty beings of great wisdom,

pli-tv-pvr2.1:29.2.eng: Knowers of the Monastic Law and skilled in the path;

pli-tv-pvr2.1:29.3.eng: Proclaimed the Collection of Monastic Law,

pli-tv-pvr2.1:29.4.eng: On the island of Sri Lanka.”

pli-tv-pvr2.1:30.1.eng: “There is an offense entailing suspension for giving the full admission to a female criminal. Where was it laid down?”

pli-tv-pvr2.1:30.6.pli: Thullanandā bhikkhunī coriṃ vuṭṭhāpesi, tasmiṃ vatthusmiṃ.
pli-tv-pvr2.1:30.6.eng: The nun Thullanandā giving the full admission to a female criminal.

pli-tv-pvr2.1:30.8.eng: Of the six kinds of originations of offenses, it originates in two ways:

pli-tv-pvr2.1:30.9.pli: siyā vācato ca cittato ca samuṭṭhāti, na kāyato;
pli-tv-pvr2.1:30.9.eng: from speech and mind, not from body; or

pli-tv-pvr2.1:30.10.pli: siyā kāyato ca vācato ca cittato ca samuṭṭhāti …pe….

pli-tv-pvr2.1:31.1.pli: Ekāya gāmantaraṃ gacchantiyā saṅghādiseso kattha paññattoti?
pli-tv-pvr2.1:31.1.eng: “There is an offense entailing suspension for walking to the next inhabited area by oneself. Where was it laid down?”

pli-tv-pvr2.1:31.6.pli: Aññatarā bhikkhunī ekā gāmantaraṃ gacchi, tasmiṃ vatthusmiṃ.
pli-tv-pvr2.1:31.6.eng: A certain nun walking to the next inhabited area by herself.

pli-tv-pvr2.1:31.7.eng: There is one rule. There are three additions to the rule.

pli-tv-pvr2.1:31.8.eng: Of the six kinds of originations of offenses, it originates in one way:

pli-tv-pvr2.1:31.9.eng: … (as in the first offense entailing expulsion) …

pli-tv-pvr2.1:32.1.pli: Samaggena saṅghena ukkhittaṃ bhikkhuniṃ dhammena vinayena satthusāsanena anapaloketvā kārakasaṅghaṃ anaññāya gaṇassa chandaṃ osārentiyā saṅghādiseso kattha paññattoti?
pli-tv-pvr2.1:32.1.eng: “There is an offense entailing suspension for readmitting a nun who had been ejected by a unanimous Sangha in accordance with the Teaching, the Monastic Law, and the Teacher’s instruction, without first getting permission from the Sangha that did the legal procedure and without the consent of the community. Where was it laid down?”

pli-tv-pvr2.1:32.6.pli: Thullanandā bhikkhunī samaggena saṅghena ukkhittaṃ bhikkhuniṃ dhammena vinayena satthusāsanena anapaloketvā kārakasaṅghaṃ anaññāya gaṇassa chandaṃ osāresi, tasmiṃ vatthusmiṃ.
pli-tv-pvr2.1:32.6.eng: The nun Thullanandā readmitting a nun who had been ejected by a unanimous Sangha in accordance with the Teaching, the Monastic Law, and the Teacher’s instruction, without first getting permission from the Sangha that did the legal procedure and without the consent of the community.

pli-tv-pvr2.1:32.8.eng: Of the six kinds of originations of offenses, it originates in one way:

pli-tv-pvr2.1:33.1.pli: Avassutāya bhikkhuniyā avassutassa purisapuggalassa hatthato khādanīyaṃ vā bhojanīyaṃ vā sahatthā paṭiggahetvā bhuñjantiyā saṅghādiseso kattha paññattoti?
pli-tv-pvr2.1:33.1.eng: “There is an offense entailing suspension for a lustful nun eating fresh or cooked food after receiving it directly from a lustful man. Where was it laid down?”

pli-tv-pvr2.1:33.6.pli: Sundarīnandā bhikkhunī avassutā avassutassa purisapuggalassa hatthato āmisaṃ paṭiggahesi, tasmiṃ vatthusmiṃ.
pli-tv-pvr2.1:33.6.eng: The nun Sundarīnandā, being lustful, receiving food directly from a lustful man.

pli-tv-pvr2.1:33.8.eng: Of the six kinds of originations of offenses, it originates in one way:

pli-tv-pvr2.1:33.9.eng: … (as in the first offense entailing expulsion) …

pli-tv-pvr2.1:34.1.pli: “Kiṃ te, ayye, eso purisapuggalo karissati avassuto vā anavassuto vā, yato tvaṃ anavassutā.
pli-tv-pvr2.1:34.1.eng: “There is an offense entailing suspension for urging a nun on, saying, ‘Venerable, what can this man do to you, whether he has lust or not, if you’re without? Go on, venerable, receive it with your own hands and then eat whatever fresh or cooked food he gives you.’ Where was it laid down?”

pli-tv-pvr2.1:34.2.pli: Iṅgha, ayye, yaṃ te eso purisapuggalo deti khādanīyaṃ vā bhojanīyaṃ vā, taṃ tvaṃ sahatthā paṭiggahetvā khāda vā bhuñja vā”ti uyyojentiyā saṅghādiseso kattha paññattoti?

pli-tv-pvr2.1:34.7.pli: Aññatarā bhikkhunī—“kiṃ te, ayye, eso purisapuggalo karissati avassuto vā anavassuto vā, yato tvaṃ anavassutā. Iṅgha, ayye, yaṃ te eso purisapuggalo deti khādanīyaṃ vā bhojanīyaṃ vā, taṃ tvaṃ sahatthā paṭiggahetvā khāda vā bhuñja vā”ti uyyojesi, tasmiṃ vatthusmiṃ.
pli-tv-pvr2.1:34.7.eng: A certain nun urging a nun on, saying, “Venerable, what can this man do to you, whether he has lust or not, if you’re without? Go on, venerable, receive it with your own hands and then eat whatever fresh or cooked food he gives you.”

pli-tv-pvr2.1:34.9.eng: Of the six kinds of originations of offenses, it originates in three ways: …

pli-tv-pvr2.1:35.1.pli: Kupitāya anattamanāya bhikkhuniyā yāvatatiyaṃ samanubhāsanāya na paṭinissajjantiyā saṅghādiseso kattha paññattoti?
pli-tv-pvr2.1:35.1.eng: “There is an offense entailing suspension for an angry nun not to stop when pressed for the third time. Where was it laid down?”

pli-tv-pvr2.1:35.6.pli: Caṇḍakāḷī bhikkhunī kupitā anattamanā evaṃ avaca—“buddhaṃ paccācikkhāmi, dhammaṃ paccācikkhāmi, saṅghaṃ paccācikkhāmi, sikkhaṃ paccācikkhāmī”ti, tasmiṃ vatthusmiṃ.
pli-tv-pvr2.1:35.6.eng: The nun Caṇḍakālī saying in anger, “I renounce the Buddha, I renounce the Teaching, I renounce the Sangha, I renounce the training!”

pli-tv-pvr2.1:35.8.eng: Of the six kinds of originations of offenses, it originates in one way:

pli-tv-pvr2.1:36.1.pli: Kismiñcideva adhikaraṇe paccākatāya bhikkhuniyā yāvatatiyaṃ samanubhāsanāya na paṭinissajjantiyā saṅghādiseso kattha paññattoti?
pli-tv-pvr2.1:36.1.eng: “There is an offense entailing suspension for a nun who has lost a legal case not to stop when pressed for the third time. Where was it laid down?”

pli-tv-pvr2.1:36.6.pli: Caṇḍakāḷī bhikkhunī kismiñcideva adhikaraṇe paccākatā kupitā anattamanā evaṃ avaca—“chandagāminiyo ca bhikkhuniyo, dosagāminiyo ca bhikkhuniyo, mohagāminiyo ca bhikkhuniyo, bhayagāminiyo ca bhikkhuniyo”ti, tasmiṃ vatthusmiṃ.
pli-tv-pvr2.1:36.6.eng: The nun Caṇḍakālī, who had lost a legal case, saying in anger, “The nuns are acting out of favoritism, ill will, confusion, and fear.”

pli-tv-pvr2.1:36.8.eng: Of the six kinds of originations of offenses, it originates in one way:

pli-tv-pvr2.1:37.1.pli: Saṃsaṭṭhānaṃ bhikkhunīnaṃ yāvatatiyaṃ samanubhāsanāya na paṭinissajjantīnaṃ saṅghādiseso kattha paññattoti?
pli-tv-pvr2.1:37.1.eng: “There is an offense entailing suspension for socializing nuns not to stop when pressed for the third time. Where was it laid down?”

pli-tv-pvr2.1:37.6.pli: Sambahulā bhikkhuniyo saṃsaṭṭhā vihariṃsu, tasmiṃ vatthusmiṃ.

pli-tv-pvr2.1:37.8.eng: Of the six kinds of originations of offenses, it originates in one way:

pli-tv-pvr2.1:38.1.eng: “There is an offense entailing suspension for urging nuns in this way: ‘Venerables, you should socialize. Don’t live separately,’ and then not to stop when pressed for the third time. Where was it laid down?”

pli-tv-pvr2.1:38.2.pli: Mā tumhe nānā viharitthā”ti uyyojentiyā yāvatatiyaṃ samanubhāsanāya na paṭinissajjantiyā saṅghādiseso kattha paññattoti?

pli-tv-pvr2.1:38.7.pli: Thullanandā bhikkhunī—“saṃsaṭṭhāva, ayye, tumhe viharatha, mā tumhe nānā viharitthā”ti uyyojesi, tasmiṃ vatthusmiṃ.
pli-tv-pvr2.1:38.7.eng: The nun Thullanandā urging the nuns on, saying, “Venerables, you should socialize. Don’t live separately.”

pli-tv-pvr2.1:38.9.eng: Of the six kinds of originations of offenses, it originates in one way:

pli-tv-pvr2.1:39.1.eng: The ten rules entailing suspension are finished.

pli-tv-pvr2.1:41.1.eng: “Litigious, a criminal, the next inhabited area,

pli-tv-pvr2.1:41.3.eng: What to you, angry, a legal issue,

pli-tv-pvr2.1:41.4.eng: Socializing, the same method: those are the ten.”

pli-tv-pvr2.1:42.1.pli: Yaṃ tena bhagavatā jānatā passatā arahatā sammāsambuddhena pattasannicayaṃ karontiyā nissaggiyaṃ pācittiyaṃ kattha paññattanti?
pli-tv-pvr2.1:42.1.eng: “The offense entailing relinquishment and confession for collecting almsbowls was laid down by the Buddha who knows and sees, the Perfected One, the fully Awakened One. Where was it laid down?”

pli-tv-pvr2.1:42.4.eng: The nuns from the group of six.

pli-tv-pvr2.1:42.6.pli: Chabbaggiyā bhikkhuniyo pattasannicayaṃ akaṃsu, tasmiṃ vatthusmiṃ.
pli-tv-pvr2.1:42.6.eng: The nuns from the group of six collecting almsbowls.

pli-tv-pvr2.1:42.8.eng: Of the six kinds of originations of offenses, it originates in two ways:

pli-tv-pvr2.1:42.9.eng: … (as in the rule on the robe season) …

pli-tv-pvr2.1:43.1.pli: Akālacīvaraṃ “kālacīvaran”ti adhiṭṭhahitvā bhājāpentiyā nissaggiyaṃ pācittiyaṃ kattha paññattanti?
pli-tv-pvr2.1:43.1.eng: “There is an offense entailing relinquishment and confession for determining out-of-season robe-cloth as ‘in-season’, and then distributing it. Where was it laid down?”

pli-tv-pvr2.1:43.6.pli: Thullanandā bhikkhunī akālacīvaraṃ “kālacīvaran”ti adhiṭṭhahitvā bhājāpesi, tasmiṃ vatthusmiṃ.
pli-tv-pvr2.1:43.6.eng: The nun Thullanandā determining out-of-season robe-cloth as “in-season”, and then distributing it.

pli-tv-pvr2.1:43.8.eng: Of the six kinds of originations of offenses, it originates in three ways: …

pli-tv-pvr2.1:44.1.pli: Bhikkhuniyā saddhiṃ cīvaraṃ parivattetvā acchindantiyā nissaggiyaṃ pācittiyaṃ kattha paññattanti?
pli-tv-pvr2.1:44.1.eng: “There is an offense entailing relinquishment and confession for trading robes with a nun and then taking it back. Where was it laid down?”

pli-tv-pvr2.1:44.6.pli: Thullanandā bhikkhunī bhikkhuniyā saddhiṃ cīvaraṃ parivattetvā acchindi, tasmiṃ vatthusmiṃ.
pli-tv-pvr2.1:44.6.eng: The nun Thullanandā trading a robe with a nun and then taking it back.

pli-tv-pvr2.1:44.8.eng: Of the six kinds of originations of offenses, it originates in three ways: …

pli-tv-pvr2.1:45.1.pli: Aññaṃ viññāpetvā aññaṃ viññāpentiyā nissaggiyaṃ pācittiyaṃ kattha paññattanti?
pli-tv-pvr2.1:45.1.eng: “There is an offense entailing relinquishment and confession for asking for one thing and then for something else. Where was it laid down?”

pli-tv-pvr2.1:45.6.pli: Thullanandā bhikkhunī aññaṃ viññāpetvā aññaṃ viññāpesi, tasmiṃ vatthusmiṃ.
pli-tv-pvr2.1:45.6.eng: The nun Thullanandā asking for one thing and then for something else.

pli-tv-pvr2.1:45.8.eng: Of the six kinds of originations of offenses, it originates in six ways: …

pli-tv-pvr2.1:46.1.pli: Aññaṃ cetāpetvā aññaṃ cetāpentiyā nissaggiyaṃ pācittiyaṃ kattha paññattanti?
pli-tv-pvr2.1:46.1.eng: “There is an offense entailing relinquishment and confession for getting one thing in exchange and then something else. Where was it laid down?”

pli-tv-pvr2.1:46.6.pli: Thullanandā bhikkhunī aññaṃ cetāpetvā aññaṃ cetāpesi, tasmiṃ vatthusmiṃ.
pli-tv-pvr2.1:46.6.eng: The nun Thullanandā getting one thing in exchange and then something else.

pli-tv-pvr2.1:46.8.eng: Of the six kinds of originations of offenses, it originates in six ways: …

pli-tv-pvr2.1:47.1.pli: Aññadatthikena parikkhārena aññuddisikena saṅghikena aññaṃ cetāpentiyā nissaggiyaṃ pācittiyaṃ katthaṃ paññattanti?
pli-tv-pvr2.1:47.1.eng: “There is an offense entailing relinquishment and confession for exchanging for something else a requisite belonging to the Sangha that is designated for a specific purpose. Where was it laid down?”

pli-tv-pvr2.1:47.6.pli: Sambahulā bhikkhuniyo aññadatthikena parikkhārena aññuddisikena saṅghikena aññaṃ cetāpesuṃ, tasmiṃ vatthusmiṃ.
pli-tv-pvr2.1:47.6.eng: A number of nuns exchanging for something else a requisite belonging to the Sangha that was designated for a specific purpose.

pli-tv-pvr2.1:47.8.eng: Of the six kinds of originations of offenses, it originates in six ways: …

pli-tv-pvr2.1:48.1.pli: Aññadatthikena parikkhārena aññuddisikena saṅghikena saññācikena aññaṃ cetāpentiyā nissaggiyaṃ pācittiyaṃ kattha paññattanti?
pli-tv-pvr2.1:48.1.eng: “There is an offense entailing relinquishment and confession for exchanging for something else a requisite belonging to the Sangha that is designated for a specific purpose and was asked for. Where was it laid down?”

pli-tv-pvr2.1:48.6.pli: Sambahulā bhikkhuniyo aññadatthikena parikkhārena aññuddisikena saṅghikena saññācikena aññaṃ cetāpesuṃ, tasmiṃ vatthusmiṃ.
pli-tv-pvr2.1:48.6.eng: A number of nuns exchanging for something else a requisite belonging to the Sangha that was designated for a specific purpose and was asked for.

pli-tv-pvr2.1:48.8.eng: Of the six kinds of originations of offenses, it originates in six ways: …

pli-tv-pvr2.1:49.1.pli: Aññadatthikena parikkhārena aññuddisikena mahājanikena aññaṃ cetāpentiyā nissaggiyaṃ pācittiyaṃ kattha paññattanti?
pli-tv-pvr2.1:49.1.eng: “There is an offense entailing relinquishment and confession for exchanging for something else a collective requisite that is designated for a specific purpose. Where was it laid down?”

pli-tv-pvr2.1:49.6.pli: Sambahulā bhikkhuniyo aññadatthikena parikkhārena aññuddisikena mahājanikena aññaṃ cetāpesuṃ, tasmiṃ vatthusmiṃ.
pli-tv-pvr2.1:49.6.eng: A number of nuns exchanging for something else a collective requisite that was designated for a specific purpose.

pli-tv-pvr2.1:49.8.eng: Of the six kinds of originations of offenses, it originates in six ways: …

pli-tv-pvr2.1:50.1.pli: Aññadatthikena parikkhārena aññuddisikena mahājanikena saññācikena aññaṃ cetāpentiyā nissaggiyaṃ pācittiyaṃ kattha paññattanti?
pli-tv-pvr2.1:50.1.eng: “There is an offense entailing relinquishment and confession for exchanging for something else a collective requisite that is designated for a specific purpose and was asked for. Where was it laid down?”

pli-tv-pvr2.1:50.6.pli: Sambahulā bhikkhuniyo aññadatthikena parikkhārena aññuddisikena mahājanikena saññācikena aññaṃ cetāpesuṃ, tasmiṃ vatthusmiṃ.
pli-tv-pvr2.1:50.6.eng: A number of nuns exchanging for something else a collective requisite that was designated for a specific purpose and was asked for.

pli-tv-pvr2.1:50.8.eng: Of the six kinds of originations of offenses, it originates in six ways: …

pli-tv-pvr2.1:51.1.pli: Aññadatthikena parikkhārena aññuddisikena puggalikena saññācikena aññaṃ cetāpentiyā nissaggiyaṃ pācittiyaṃ kattha paññattanti?
pli-tv-pvr2.1:51.1.eng: “There is an offense entailing relinquishment and confession for exchanging for something else a personal requisite that is designated for a specific purpose and was asked for. Where was it laid down?”

pli-tv-pvr2.1:51.6.pli: Thullanandā bhikkhunī aññadatthikena parikkhārena aññuddisikena puggalikena saññācikena aññaṃ cetāpesi, tasmiṃ vatthusmiṃ.
pli-tv-pvr2.1:51.6.eng: The nun Thullanandā exchanging for something else a personal requisite that was designated for a specific purpose and was asked for.

pli-tv-pvr2.1:51.8.eng: Of the six kinds of originations of offenses, it originates in six ways: …

pli-tv-pvr2.1:52.1.pli: Atirekacatukkaṃsaparamaṃ garupāvuraṇaṃ cetāpentiyā nissaggiyaṃ pācittiyaṃ kattha paññattanti?
pli-tv-pvr2.1:52.1.eng: “There is an offense entailing relinquishment and confession for getting in exchange a heavy cloak worth more than four kaṁsa coins. Where was it laid down?”

pli-tv-pvr2.1:52.6.pli: Thullanandā bhikkhunī rājānaṃ kambalaṃ viññāpesi, tasmiṃ vatthusmiṃ.
pli-tv-pvr2.1:52.6.eng: The nun Thullanandā asking the king for a woolen cloak.

pli-tv-pvr2.1:52.8.eng: Of the six kinds of originations of offenses, it originates in six ways: …

pli-tv-pvr2.1:53.1.pli: Atirekaaḍḍhateyyakaṃsaparamaṃ lahupāvuraṇaṃ cetāpentiyā nissaggiyaṃ pācittiyaṃ kattha paññattanti?
pli-tv-pvr2.1:53.1.eng: “There is an offense entailing relinquishment and confession for getting in exchange a light cloak worth more than two-and-a-half kaṁsa coins. Where was it laid down?”

pli-tv-pvr2.1:53.6.pli: Thullanandā bhikkhunī rājānaṃ khomaṃ viññāpesi, tasmiṃ vatthusmiṃ.
pli-tv-pvr2.1:53.6.eng: The nun Thullanandā asking the king for a linen cloak.

pli-tv-pvr2.1:53.8.eng: Of the six kinds of originations of offenses, it originates in six ways: …

pli-tv-pvr2.1:54.1.eng: The twelve rules on relinquishment and confession are finished.

pli-tv-pvr2.1:56.3.eng: Getting in exchange, a specific purpose,

pli-tv-pvr2.1:56.4.eng: And belonging to the Sangha, collective;

pli-tv-pvr2.1:57.0.1.eng: 4. The chapter on offenses entailing confession

pli-tv-pvr2.1:57.1.pli: Yaṃ tena bhagavatā jānatā passatā arahatā sammāsambuddhena lasuṇaṃ khādantiyā pācittiyaṃ kattha paññattanti?
pli-tv-pvr2.1:57.1.eng: “The offense entailing confession for eating garlic was laid down by the Buddha who knows and sees, the Perfected One, the fully Awakened One. Where was it laid down?”

pli-tv-pvr2.1:57.6.pli: Thullanandā bhikkhunī na mattaṃ jānitvā lasuṇaṃ harāpesi, tasmiṃ vatthusmiṃ.
pli-tv-pvr2.1:57.6.eng: The nun Thullanandā taking garlic without any sense of moderation.

pli-tv-pvr2.1:57.8.pli: Channaṃ āpattisamuṭṭhānānaṃ dvīhi samuṭṭhānehi samuṭṭhāti eḷakalomake …pe….
pli-tv-pvr2.1:57.8.eng: Of the six kinds of originations of offenses, it originates in two ways: … (as in the rule on wool) …

pli-tv-pvr2.1:58.1.pli: Sambādhe lomaṃ saṃharāpentiyā pācittiyaṃ kattha paññattanti?
pli-tv-pvr2.1:58.1.eng: “There is an offense entailing confession for removing hair from the private parts. Where was it laid down?”

pli-tv-pvr2.1:58.4.eng: The nuns from the group of six.

pli-tv-pvr2.1:58.6.pli: Chabbaggiyā bhikkhuniyo sambādhe lomaṃ saṃharāpesuṃ, tasmiṃ vatthusmiṃ.
pli-tv-pvr2.1:58.6.eng: The nuns from the group of six removing hair from their private parts.

pli-tv-pvr2.1:58.8.eng: Of the six kinds of originations of offenses, it originates in four ways: …

pli-tv-pvr2.1:59.1.eng: “There is an offense entailing confession for slapping the genitals with the palm of the hand. Where was it laid down?”

pli-tv-pvr2.1:59.6.pli: Dve bhikkhuniyo talaghātakaṃ akaṃsu, tasmiṃ vatthusmiṃ.
pli-tv-pvr2.1:59.6.eng: Two nuns slapping their genitals with the palms of their hands.

pli-tv-pvr2.1:59.8.eng: Of the six kinds of originations of offenses, it originates in one way:

pli-tv-pvr2.1:59.9.eng: … (as in the first offense entailing expulsion) …

pli-tv-pvr2.1:60.1.eng: “There is an offense entailing confession for using a dildo. Where was it laid down?”

pli-tv-pvr2.1:60.6.pli: Aññatarā bhikkhunī jatumaṭṭhakaṃ ādiyi, tasmiṃ vatthusmiṃ.
pli-tv-pvr2.1:60.6.eng: A certain nun using a dildo.

pli-tv-pvr2.1:60.8.eng: Of the six kinds of originations of offenses, it originates in one way:

pli-tv-pvr2.1:60.9.eng: … (as in the first offense entailing expulsion) …

pli-tv-pvr2.1:61.1.pli: Atirekadvaṅgulapabbaparamaṃ udakasuddhikaṃ ādiyantiyā pācittiyaṃ kattha paññattanti?
pli-tv-pvr2.1:61.1.eng: “There is an offense entailing confession for cleaning oneself with water by inserting more than two finger joints. Where was it laid down?”

pli-tv-pvr2.1:61.6.pli: Aññatarā bhikkhunī atigambhīraṃ udakasuddhikaṃ ādiyi, tasmiṃ vatthusmiṃ.
pli-tv-pvr2.1:61.6.eng: A certain nun cleaning herself too deeply with water.

pli-tv-pvr2.1:61.8.eng: Of the six kinds of originations of offenses, it originates in one way:

pli-tv-pvr2.1:61.9.eng: … (as in the first offense entailing expulsion) …

pli-tv-pvr2.1:62.1.pli: Bhikkhussa bhuñjantassa pānīyena vā vidhūpanena vā upatiṭṭhantiyā pācittiyaṃ kattha paññattanti?
pli-tv-pvr2.1:62.1.eng: “There is an offense entailing confession for attending on a monk who is eating with drinking water or a fan. Where was it laid down?”

pli-tv-pvr2.1:62.6.pli: Aññatarā bhikkhunī bhikkhussa bhuñjantassa pānīyena ca vidhūpanena ca upatiṭṭhi, tasmiṃ vatthusmiṃ.
pli-tv-pvr2.1:62.6.eng: A certain nun attending on a monk who is eating with drinking water or a fan.

pli-tv-pvr2.1:62.8.eng: Of the six kinds of originations of offenses, it originates in two ways:

pli-tv-pvr2.1:63.1.pli: Āmakadhaññaṃ viññāpetvā bhuñjantiyā pācittiyaṃ kattha paññattanti?
pli-tv-pvr2.1:63.1.eng: “There is an offense entailing confession for asking for raw grain and then eating it. Where was it laid down?”

pli-tv-pvr2.1:63.6.pli: Sambahulā bhikkhuniyo āmakadhaññaṃ viññāpetvā bhuñjiṃsu, tasmiṃ vatthusmiṃ.
pli-tv-pvr2.1:63.6.eng: A number of nuns asking for raw grain and then eating it.

pli-tv-pvr2.1:63.8.eng: Of the six kinds of originations of offenses, it originates in four ways: …

pli-tv-pvr2.1:64.1.pli: Uccāraṃ vā passāvaṃ vā saṅkāraṃ vā vighāsaṃ vā tirokuṭṭe chaḍḍentiyā pācittiyaṃ kattha paññattanti?
pli-tv-pvr2.1:64.1.eng: “There is an offense entailing confession for disposing of feces, urine, trash, or food scraps over a wall. Where was it laid down?”

pli-tv-pvr2.1:64.6.pli: Aññatarā bhikkhunī uccāraṃ tirokuṭṭe chaḍḍesi, tasmiṃ vatthusmiṃ.
pli-tv-pvr2.1:64.6.eng: A certain nun disposing of feces over a wall.

pli-tv-pvr2.1:64.8.eng: Of the six kinds of originations of offenses, it originates in six ways: …

pli-tv-pvr2.1:65.1.pli: Uccāraṃ vā passāvaṃ vā saṅkāraṃ vā vighāsaṃ vā harite chaḍḍentiyā pācittiyaṃ kattha paññattanti?
pli-tv-pvr2.1:65.1.eng: “There is an offense entailing confession for disposing of feces, urine, trash, or food scraps on cultivated plants. Where was it laid down?”

pli-tv-pvr2.1:65.6.pli: Sambahulā bhikkhuniyo uccārampi passāvampi saṅkārampi vighāsampi harite chaḍḍesuṃ, tasmiṃ vatthusmiṃ.
pli-tv-pvr2.1:65.6.eng: A number of nuns disposing of feces, urine, trash, and food scraps on cultivated plants.

pli-tv-pvr2.1:65.8.eng: Of the six kinds of originations of offenses, it originates in six ways: …

pli-tv-pvr2.1:66.1.pli: Naccaṃ vā gītaṃ vā vāditaṃ vā dassanāya gacchantiyā pācittiyaṃ kattha paññattanti?
pli-tv-pvr2.1:66.1.eng: “There is an offense entailing confession for going to see dancing, singing, or music. Where was it laid down?”

pli-tv-pvr2.1:66.4.eng: The nuns from the group of six.

pli-tv-pvr2.1:66.6.pli: Chabbaggiyā bhikkhuniyo naccampi gītampi vāditampi dassanāya agamaṃsu, tasmiṃ vatthusmiṃ.
pli-tv-pvr2.1:66.6.eng: The nuns from the group of six going to see dancing, singing, and music.

pli-tv-pvr2.1:66.8.eng: Of the six kinds of originations of offenses, it originates in two ways:

pli-tv-pvr2.1:67.1.eng: The first subchapter on garlic is finished.

pli-tv-pvr2.1:68.0.eng: The subchapter on the dark of the night

pli-tv-pvr2.1:68.1.pli: Rattandhakāre appadīpe purisena saddhiṃ ekenekāya santiṭṭhantiyā pācittiyaṃ kattha paññattanti?
pli-tv-pvr2.1:68.1.eng: “There is an offense entailing confession for standing alone with a man in the dark of the night without a lamp. Where was it laid down?”

pli-tv-pvr2.1:68.6.pli: Aññatarā bhikkhunī rattandhakāre appadīpe purisena saddhiṃ ekenekā santiṭṭhi, tasmiṃ vatthusmiṃ.
pli-tv-pvr2.1:68.6.eng: A certain nun standing alone with a man in the dark of the night without a lamp.

pli-tv-pvr2.1:68.8.eng: Of the six kinds of originations of offenses, it originates in two ways:

pli-tv-pvr2.1:68.9.eng: … (as in the rule on a group of traveling thieves) …

pli-tv-pvr2.1:69.1.pli: Paṭicchanne okāse purisena saddhiṃ ekenekāya santiṭṭhantiyā pācittiyaṃ kattha paññattanti?
pli-tv-pvr2.1:69.1.eng: “There is an offense entailing confession for standing alone with a man in a concealed place. Where was it laid down?”

pli-tv-pvr2.1:69.6.pli: Aññatarā bhikkhunī paṭicchanne okāse purisena saddhiṃ ekenekā santiṭṭhi, tasmiṃ vatthusmiṃ.
pli-tv-pvr2.1:69.6.eng: A certain nun standing alone with a man in a concealed place.

pli-tv-pvr2.1:69.8.eng: Of the six kinds of originations of offenses, it originates in two ways:

pli-tv-pvr2.1:69.9.eng: … (as in the rule on a group of traveling thieves) …

pli-tv-pvr2.1:70.1.pli: Ajjhokāse purisena saddhiṃ ekenekāya santiṭṭhantiyā pācittiyaṃ kattha paññattanti?
pli-tv-pvr2.1:70.1.eng: “There is an offense entailing confession for standing alone with a man out in the open. Where was it laid down?”

pli-tv-pvr2.1:70.6.pli: Aññatarā bhikkhunī ajjhokāse purisena saddhiṃ ekenekā santiṭṭhi, tasmiṃ vatthusmiṃ.
pli-tv-pvr2.1:70.6.eng: A certain nun standing alone with a man out in the open.

pli-tv-pvr2.1:70.8.eng: Of the six kinds of originations of offenses, it originates in two ways:

pli-tv-pvr2.1:70.9.eng: … (as in the rule on a group of traveling thieves) …

pli-tv-pvr2.1:71.1.pli: Rathikāya vā byūhe vā siṅghāṭake vā purisena saddhiṃ ekenekāya santiṭṭhantiyā pācittiyaṃ kattha paññattanti?
pli-tv-pvr2.1:71.1.eng: “There is an offense entailing confession for standing alone with a man on a street, in a cul-de-sac, or at an intersection. Where was it laid down?”

pli-tv-pvr2.1:71.6.pli: Thullanandā bhikkhunī rathikāyapi byūhepi siṅghāṭakepi purisena saddhiṃ ekenekā santiṭṭhi, tasmiṃ vatthusmiṃ.
pli-tv-pvr2.1:71.6.eng: The nun Thullanandā standing alone with a man on a street, in a cul-de-sac, and at an intersection.

pli-tv-pvr2.1:71.8.eng: Of the six kinds of originations of offenses, it originates in two ways:

pli-tv-pvr2.1:71.9.eng: … (as in the rule on a group of traveling thieves) …

pli-tv-pvr2.1:72.1.pli: Purebhattaṃ kulāni upasaṅkamitvā āsane nisīditvā sāmike anāpucchā pakkamantiyā pācittiyaṃ kattha paññattanti?
pli-tv-pvr2.1:72.1.eng: “There is an offense entailing confession for visiting families before the meal, sitting down on a seat, and then departing without informing the owners. Where was it laid down?”

pli-tv-pvr2.1:72.6.pli: Aññatarā bhikkhunī purebhattaṃ kulāni upasaṅkamitvā āsane nisīditvā sāmike anāpucchā pakkāmi, tasmiṃ vatthusmiṃ.
pli-tv-pvr2.1:72.6.eng: A certain nun visiting families before the meal, sitting down on a seat, and then departing without informing the owners.

pli-tv-pvr2.1:72.8.eng: Of the six kinds of originations of offenses, it originates in two ways:

pli-tv-pvr2.1:72.9.eng: … (as in the rule on the robe season) …

pli-tv-pvr2.1:73.1.pli: Pacchābhattaṃ kulāni upasaṅkamitvā sāmike anāpucchā āsane abhinisīdantiyā pācittiyaṃ kattha paññattanti?
pli-tv-pvr2.1:73.1.eng: “There is an offense entailing confession for visiting families after the meal and then sitting down on a seat without asking permission of the owners. Where was it laid down?”

pli-tv-pvr2.1:73.6.pli: Thullanandā bhikkhunī pacchābhattaṃ kulāni upasaṅkamitvā sāmike anāpucchā āsane abhinisīdi, tasmiṃ vatthusmiṃ.
pli-tv-pvr2.1:73.6.eng: The nun Thullanandā visiting families after the meal and then sitting down on a seat without asking permission of the owners.

pli-tv-pvr2.1:73.8.eng: Of the six kinds of originations of offenses, it originates in two ways:

pli-tv-pvr2.1:73.9.eng: … (as in the rule on the robe season) …

pli-tv-pvr2.1:74.1.pli: Vikāle kulāni upasaṅkamitvā sāmike anāpucchā seyyaṃ santharitvā vā santharāpetvā vā abhinisīdantiyā pācittiyaṃ kattha paññattanti?
pli-tv-pvr2.1:74.1.eng: “There is an offense entailing confession for visiting families at the wrong time, putting out bedding without asking permission of the owners, or having it put out, and then sitting down. Where was it laid down?”

pli-tv-pvr2.1:74.6.pli: Sambahulā bhikkhuniyo vikāle kulāni upasaṅkamitvā sāmike anāpucchā seyyaṃ santharitvā abhinisīdiṃsu, tasmiṃ vatthusmiṃ.
pli-tv-pvr2.1:74.6.eng: A number of nuns visiting families at the wrong time, putting out bedding without asking permission of the owners, and then sitting down.

pli-tv-pvr2.1:74.8.eng: Of the six kinds of originations of offenses, it originates in two ways:

pli-tv-pvr2.1:74.9.eng: … (as in the rule on the robe season) …

pli-tv-pvr2.1:75.1.pli: Duggahitena dūpadhāritena paraṃ ujjhāpentiyā pācittiyaṃ kattha paññattanti?
pli-tv-pvr2.1:75.1.eng: “There is an offense entailing confession for complaining about someone because of a misunderstanding and a lack of proper reflection. Where was it laid down?”

pli-tv-pvr2.1:75.6.pli: Aññatarā bhikkhunī duggahitena dūpadhāritena paraṃ ujjhāpesi, tasmiṃ vatthusmiṃ.
pli-tv-pvr2.1:75.6.eng: A certain nun complaining about someone because of a misunderstanding and a lack of proper reflection.

pli-tv-pvr2.1:75.8.eng: Of the six kinds of originations of offenses, it originates in three ways: …

pli-tv-pvr2.1:76.1.pli: Attānaṃ vā paraṃ vā nirayena vā brahmacariyena vā abhisapantiyā pācittiyaṃ kattha paññattanti?
pli-tv-pvr2.1:76.1.eng: “There is an offense entailing confession for referring to hell or the spiritual life to curse oneself or someone else. Where was it laid down?”

pli-tv-pvr2.1:76.6.pli: Caṇḍakāḷī bhikkhunī attānampi parampi nirayenapi brahmacariyenapi abhisapi, tasmiṃ vatthusmiṃ.
pli-tv-pvr2.1:76.6.eng: The nun Caṇḍakālī referring to hell and the spiritual life to curse herself and someone else.

pli-tv-pvr2.1:76.8.eng: Of the six kinds of originations of offenses, it originates in three ways: …

pli-tv-pvr2.1:77.1.pli: Attānaṃ vadhitvā vadhitvā rodantiyā pācittiyaṃ kattha paññattanti?
pli-tv-pvr2.1:77.1.eng: “There is an offense entailing confession for crying after repeatedly beating oneself. Where was it laid down?”

pli-tv-pvr2.1:77.6.pli: Caṇḍakāḷī bhikkhunī attānaṃ vadhitvā vadhitvā rodi, tasmiṃ vatthusmiṃ.
pli-tv-pvr2.1:77.6.eng: The nun Caṇḍakālī crying after repeatedly beating herself.

pli-tv-pvr2.1:77.8.eng: Of the six kinds of originations of offenses, it originates in one way:

pli-tv-pvr2.1:78.1.eng: The second subchapter on the dark of the night is finished.

pli-tv-pvr2.1:79.1.eng: “There is an offense entailing confession for bathing naked. Where was it laid down?”

pli-tv-pvr2.1:79.6.pli: Sambahulā bhikkhuniyo naggā nahāyiṃsu, tasmiṃ vatthusmiṃ.
pli-tv-pvr2.1:79.6.eng: A number of nuns bathing naked.

pli-tv-pvr2.1:79.8.eng: Of the six kinds of originations of offenses, it originates in two ways:

pli-tv-pvr2.1:80.1.pli: Pamāṇātikkantaṃ udakasāṭikaṃ kārāpentiyā pācittiyaṃ kattha paññattanti?
pli-tv-pvr2.1:80.1.eng: “There is an offense entailing confession for making a bathing robe that exceeds the right size. Where was it laid down?”

pli-tv-pvr2.1:80.4.eng: The nuns from the group of six.

pli-tv-pvr2.1:80.6.pli: Chabbaggiyā bhikkhuniyo appamāṇikāyo udakasāṭikāyo dhāresuṃ, tasmiṃ vatthusmiṃ.
pli-tv-pvr2.1:80.6.eng: The nuns from the group of six wearing bathing robes that exceeded the right size.

pli-tv-pvr2.1:80.8.eng: Of the six kinds of originations of offenses, it originates in six ways: …

pli-tv-pvr2.1:81.1.pli: Bhikkhuniyā cīvaraṃ visibbetvā vā visibbāpetvā vā neva sibbentiyā na sibbāpanāya ussukkaṃ karontiyā pācittiyaṃ kattha paññattanti?
pli-tv-pvr2.1:81.1.eng: “There is an offense entailing confession for unstitching a nun’s robe, or having it unstitched, and then neither sewing it oneself nor making any effort to have someone else sew it. Where was it laid down?”

pli-tv-pvr2.1:81.6.pli: Thullanandā bhikkhunī bhikkhuniyā cīvaraṃ visibbāpetvā neva sibbesi na sibbāpanāya ussukkaṃ akāsi, tasmiṃ vatthusmiṃ.
pli-tv-pvr2.1:81.6.eng: The nun Thullanandā unstitching a nun’s robe and then neither sewing it herself nor making any effort to have someone else sew it.

pli-tv-pvr2.1:81.8.eng: Of the six kinds of originations of offenses, it originates in one way:

pli-tv-pvr2.1:82.1.pli: Pañcāhikaṃ saṅghāṭicāraṃ atikkāmentiyā pācittiyaṃ kattha paññattanti?
pli-tv-pvr2.1:82.1.eng: “There is an offense entailing confession for not moving one’s robes for more than five days. Where was it laid down?”

pli-tv-pvr2.1:82.6.pli: Sambahulā bhikkhuniyo bhikkhunīnaṃ hatthe cīvaraṃ nikkhipitvā santaruttarena janapadacārikaṃ pakkamiṃsu, tasmiṃ vatthusmiṃ.
pli-tv-pvr2.1:82.6.eng: A number of nuns storing a robe with other nuns and then leaving to wander the country in a sarong and an upper robe.

pli-tv-pvr2.1:82.8.pli: Channaṃ āpattisamuṭṭhānānaṃ dvīhi samuṭṭhānehi samuṭṭhāti kathinake …pe….
pli-tv-pvr2.1:82.8.eng: Of the six kinds of originations of offenses, it originates in two ways: … (as in the rule on the robe season) …

pli-tv-pvr2.1:83.1.eng: “There is an offense entailing confession for wearing a robe taken on loan. Where was it laid down?”

pli-tv-pvr2.1:83.6.pli: Aññatarā bhikkhunī aññatarāya bhikkhuniyā cīvaraṃ anāpucchā pārupi, tasmiṃ vatthusmiṃ.
pli-tv-pvr2.1:83.6.eng: A certain nun putting on another nun’s robe without asking permission.

pli-tv-pvr2.1:83.8.eng: Of the six kinds of originations of offenses, it originates in two ways:

pli-tv-pvr2.1:83.9.eng: … (as in the rule on the robe season) …

pli-tv-pvr2.1:84.1.pli: Gaṇassa cīvaralābhaṃ antarāyaṃ karontiyā pācittiyaṃ kattha paññattanti?
pli-tv-pvr2.1:84.1.eng: “There is an offense entailing confession for creating an obstacle for the community to get robe-cloth. Where was it laid down?”

pli-tv-pvr2.1:84.6.pli: Thullanandā bhikkhunī gaṇassa cīvaralābhaṃ antarāyaṃ akāsi, tasmiṃ vatthusmiṃ.
pli-tv-pvr2.1:84.6.eng: The nun Thullanandā creating an obstacle for a community to get robe-cloth.

pli-tv-pvr2.1:84.8.eng: Of the six kinds of originations of offenses, it originates in three ways: …

pli-tv-pvr2.1:85.1.pli: Dhammikaṃ cīvaravibhaṅgaṃ paṭibāhantiyā pācittiyaṃ kattha paññattanti.
pli-tv-pvr2.1:85.1.eng: “There is an offense entailing confession for blocking a legitimate distribution of robe-cloth. Where was it laid down?”

pli-tv-pvr2.1:85.6.pli: Thullanandā bhikkhunī dhammikaṃ cīvaravibhaṅgaṃ paṭibāhi, tasmiṃ vatthusmiṃ.
pli-tv-pvr2.1:85.6.eng: The nun Thullanandā blocking a legitimate distribution of robe-cloth.

pli-tv-pvr2.1:85.8.eng: Of the six kinds of originations of offenses, it originates in three ways: …

pli-tv-pvr2.1:86.1.pli: Agārikassa vā paribbājakassa vā paribbājikāya vā samaṇacīvaraṃ dentiyā pācittiyaṃ kattha paññattanti?
pli-tv-pvr2.1:86.1.eng: “There is an offense entailing confession for giving a monastic robe to a householder, a male wanderer, or a female wanderer. Where was it laid down?”

pli-tv-pvr2.1:86.6.pli: Thullanandā bhikkhunī agārikassa samaṇacīvaraṃ adāsi, tasmiṃ vatthusmiṃ.
pli-tv-pvr2.1:86.6.eng: The nun Thullanandā giving a monastic robe to a householder.

pli-tv-pvr2.1:86.8.eng: Of the six kinds of originations of offenses, it originates in six ways: …

pli-tv-pvr2.1:87.1.pli: Dubbalacīvarapaccāsāya cīvarakālasamayaṃ atikkāmentiyā pācittiyaṃ kattha paññattanti?
pli-tv-pvr2.1:87.1.eng: “There is an offense entailing confession for letting the robe season expire because of an uncertain expectation of robe-cloth. Where was it laid down?”

pli-tv-pvr2.1:87.6.pli: Thullanandā bhikkhunī dubbalacīvarapaccāsāya cīvarakālasamayaṃ atikkāmesi, tasmiṃ vatthusmiṃ.
pli-tv-pvr2.1:87.6.eng: The nun Thullanandā letting the robe season expire because of an uncertain expectation of robe-cloth.

pli-tv-pvr2.1:87.8.eng: Of the six kinds of originations of offenses, it originates in three ways: …

pli-tv-pvr2.1:88.1.pli: Dhammikaṃ kathinuddhāraṃ paṭibāhantiyā pācittiyaṃ kattha paññattanti?
pli-tv-pvr2.1:88.1.eng: “There is an offense entailing confession for blocking a legitimate ending of the robe season. Where was it laid down?”

pli-tv-pvr2.1:88.6.pli: Thullanandā bhikkhunī dhammikaṃ kathinuddhāraṃ paṭibāhi, tasmiṃ vatthusmiṃ.
pli-tv-pvr2.1:88.6.eng: The nun Thullanandā blocking a legitimate ending of the robe season.

pli-tv-pvr2.1:88.8.eng: Of the six kinds of originations of offenses, it originates in three ways: …

pli-tv-pvr2.1:89.1.eng: The third subchapter on bathing is finished.

pli-tv-pvr2.1:90.1.pli: Dvinnaṃ bhikkhunīnaṃ ekamañce tuvaṭṭentīnaṃ pācittiyaṃ kattha paññattanti?
pli-tv-pvr2.1:90.1.eng: “There is an offense entailing confession for two nuns to lie down on the same bed. Where was it laid down?”

pli-tv-pvr2.1:90.6.pli: Sambahulā bhikkhuniyo dve ekamañce tuvaṭṭesuṃ, tasmiṃ vatthusmiṃ.
pli-tv-pvr2.1:90.6.eng: A number of nuns lying down in pairs on the same bed.

pli-tv-pvr2.1:90.8.eng: Of the six kinds of originations of offenses, it originates in two ways:

pli-tv-pvr2.1:91.1.pli: Dvinnaṃ bhikkhunīnaṃ ekattharaṇapāvuraṇe tuvaṭṭentīnaṃ pācittiyaṃ kattha paññattanti?
pli-tv-pvr2.1:91.1.eng: “There is an offense entailing confession for two nuns to lie down on the same sheet and under the same cover. Where was it laid down?”

pli-tv-pvr2.1:91.6.pli: Sambahulā bhikkhuniyo dve ekattharaṇapāvuraṇā tuvaṭṭesuṃ, tasmiṃ vatthusmiṃ.
pli-tv-pvr2.1:91.6.eng: A number of nuns lying down in pairs on the same sheet and under the same cover.

pli-tv-pvr2.1:91.8.eng: Of the six kinds of originations of offenses, it originates in two ways:

pli-tv-pvr2.1:92.1.pli: Bhikkhuniyā sañcicca aphāsuṃ karontiyā pācittiyaṃ kattha paññattanti?
pli-tv-pvr2.1:92.1.eng: “There is an offense entailing confession for intentionally making a nun ill at ease. Where was it laid down?”

pli-tv-pvr2.1:92.6.pli: Thullanandā bhikkhunī bhikkhuniyā sañcicca aphāsuṃ akāsi, tasmiṃ vatthusmiṃ.
pli-tv-pvr2.1:92.6.eng: The nun Thullanandā intentionally making a nun ill at ease.

pli-tv-pvr2.1:92.8.eng: Of the six kinds of originations of offenses, it originates in three ways: …

pli-tv-pvr2.1:93.1.pli: Dukkhitaṃ sahajīviniṃ neva upaṭṭhentiyā na upaṭṭhāpanāya ussukkaṃ karontiyā pācittiyaṃ kattha paññattanti?
pli-tv-pvr2.1:93.1.eng: “There is an offense entailing confession for not nursing a suffering disciple, nor making any effort to have someone else nurse her. Where was it laid down?”

pli-tv-pvr2.1:93.6.pli: Thullanandā bhikkhunī dukkhitaṃ sahajīviniṃ neva upaṭṭhesi na upaṭṭhāpanāya ussukkaṃ akāsi, tasmiṃ vatthusmiṃ.
pli-tv-pvr2.1:93.6.eng: The nun Thullanandā not nursing a suffering disciple, nor making any effort to have someone else nurse her.

pli-tv-pvr2.1:93.8.eng: Of the six kinds of originations of offenses, it originates in one way:

pli-tv-pvr2.1:94.1.pli: Bhikkhuniyā upassayaṃ datvā kupitāya anattamanāya nikkaḍḍhantiyā pācittiyaṃ kattha paññattanti?
pli-tv-pvr2.1:94.1.eng: “There is an offense entailing confession for giving a dwelling place to a nun, and then, in anger, throwing her out. Where was it laid down?”

pli-tv-pvr2.1:94.6.pli: Thullanandā bhikkhunī bhikkhuniyā upassayaṃ datvā kupitā anattamanā nikkaḍḍhi, tasmiṃ vatthusmiṃ.
pli-tv-pvr2.1:94.6.eng: The nun Thullanandā giving a dwelling place to a nun, and then, in anger, throwing her out.

pli-tv-pvr2.1:94.8.eng: Of the six kinds of originations of offenses, it originates in three ways: …

pli-tv-pvr2.1:95.1.pli: Saṃsaṭṭhāya bhikkhuniyā yāvatatiyaṃ samanubhāsanāya na paṭinissajjantiyā pācittiyaṃ kattha paññattanti?
pli-tv-pvr2.1:95.1.eng: “There is an offense entailing confession for a socializing nun not to stop when pressed for the third time. Where was it laid down?”

pli-tv-pvr2.1:95.6.pli: Caṇḍakāḷī bhikkhunī saṃsaṭṭhā vihari, tasmiṃ vatthusmiṃ.

pli-tv-pvr2.1:95.8.eng: Of the six kinds of originations of offenses, it originates in one way:

pli-tv-pvr2.1:96.1.pli: Antoraṭṭhe sāsaṅkasammate sappaṭibhaye asatthikāya cārikaṃ carantiyā pācittiyaṃ kattha paññattanti?
pli-tv-pvr2.1:96.1.eng: “There is an offense entailing confession for wandering without a group of travelers where it is considered risky and dangerous within one’s own country. Where was it laid down?”

pli-tv-pvr2.1:96.6.pli: Sambahulā bhikkhuniyo antoraṭṭhe sāsaṅkasammate sappaṭibhaye asatthikāyo cārikaṃ cariṃsu, tasmiṃ vatthusmiṃ.
pli-tv-pvr2.1:96.6.eng: A number of nuns wandering without a group of travelers where it was considered risky and dangerous within their own country.

pli-tv-pvr2.1:96.8.eng: Of the six kinds of originations of offenses, it originates in two ways:

pli-tv-pvr2.1:97.1.pli: Tiroraṭṭhe sāsaṅkasammate sappaṭibhaye asatthikāya cārikaṃ carantiyā pācittiyaṃ kattha paññattanti?
pli-tv-pvr2.1:97.1.eng: “There is an offense entailing confession for wandering without a group of travelers where it is considered risky and dangerous outside one’s own country. Where was it laid down?”

pli-tv-pvr2.1:97.6.pli: Sambahulā bhikkhuniyo tiroraṭṭhe sāsaṅkasammate sappaṭibhaye asatthikāyo cārikaṃ cariṃsu, tasmiṃ vatthusmiṃ.
pli-tv-pvr2.1:97.6.eng: A number of nuns wandering without a group of travelers where it was considered risky and dangerous outside their own country.

pli-tv-pvr2.1:97.8.eng: Of the six kinds of originations of offenses, it originates in two ways:

pli-tv-pvr2.1:98.1.pli: Antovassaṃ cārikaṃ carantiyā pācittiyaṃ kattha paññattanti?
pli-tv-pvr2.1:98.1.eng: “There is an offense entailing confession for wandering during the rainy season. Where was it laid down?”

pli-tv-pvr2.1:98.6.pli: Sambahulā bhikkhuniyo antovassaṃ cārikaṃ cariṃsu, tasmiṃ vatthusmiṃ.
pli-tv-pvr2.1:98.6.eng: A number of nuns wandering during the rainy season.

pli-tv-pvr2.1:98.8.eng: Of the six kinds of originations of offenses, it originates in two ways:

pli-tv-pvr2.1:99.1.pli: Vassaṃvuṭṭhāya bhikkhuniyā cārikaṃ na pakkamantiyā pācittiyaṃ kattha paññattanti?
pli-tv-pvr2.1:99.1.eng: “There is an offense entailing confession for a nun who has completed the rainy-season residence not to go wandering. Where was it laid down?”

pli-tv-pvr2.1:99.6.pli: Sambahulā bhikkhuniyo vassaṃvuṭṭhā cārikaṃ na pakkamiṃsu, tasmiṃ vatthusmiṃ.
pli-tv-pvr2.1:99.6.eng: A number of nuns who did not go wandering after completing the rainy-season residence.

pli-tv-pvr2.1:99.8.eng: Of the six kinds of originations of offenses, it originates in one way:

pli-tv-pvr2.1:99.9.eng: … (as in the first offense entailing expulsion) …

pli-tv-pvr2.1:100.1.eng: The fourth subchapter on lying down is finished.

pli-tv-pvr2.1:101.1.pli: Rājāgāraṃ vā cittāgāraṃ vā ārāmaṃ vā uyyānaṃ vā pokkharaṇiṃ vā dassanāya gacchantiyā pācittiyaṃ kattha paññattanti?
pli-tv-pvr2.1:101.1.eng: “There is an offense entailing confession for visiting a royal house, a gallery, a park, a garden, or a lotus pond. Where was it laid down?”

pli-tv-pvr2.1:101.4.eng: The nuns from the group of six.

pli-tv-pvr2.1:101.6.pli: Chabbaggiyā bhikkhuniyo rājāgārampi cittāgārampi dassanāya agamaṃsu, tasmiṃ vatthusmiṃ.
pli-tv-pvr2.1:101.6.eng: The nuns from the group of six visiting a royal house and a gallery.

pli-tv-pvr2.1:101.8.eng: Of the six kinds of originations of offenses, it originates in two ways:

pli-tv-pvr2.1:102.1.pli: Āsandiṃ vā pallaṅkaṃ vā paribhuñjantiyā pācittiyaṃ kattha paññattanti?
pli-tv-pvr2.1:102.1.eng: “There is an offense entailing confession for using a high or luxurious couch. Where was it laid down?”

pli-tv-pvr2.1:102.6.pli: Sambahulā bhikkhuniyo āsandimpi pallaṅkampi paribhuñjiṃsu, tasmiṃ vatthusmiṃ.
pli-tv-pvr2.1:102.6.eng: A number of nuns using high and luxurious couches.

pli-tv-pvr2.1:102.8.eng: Of the six kinds of originations of offenses, it originates in two ways:

pli-tv-pvr2.1:103.1.eng: “There is an offense entailing confession for spinning yarn. Where was it laid down?”

pli-tv-pvr2.1:103.4.eng: The nuns from the group of six.

pli-tv-pvr2.1:103.6.pli: Chabbaggiyā bhikkhuniyo suttaṃ kantiṃsu, tasmiṃ vatthusmiṃ.
pli-tv-pvr2.1:103.6.eng: The nuns from the group of six spinning yarn.

pli-tv-pvr2.1:103.8.eng: Of the six kinds of originations of offenses, it originates in two ways:

pli-tv-pvr2.1:104.1.eng: “There is an offense entailing confession for providing services for a householder. Where was it laid down?”

pli-tv-pvr2.1:104.6.pli: Sambahulā bhikkhuniyo gihiveyyāvaccaṃ akaṃsu, tasmiṃ vatthusmiṃ.
pli-tv-pvr2.1:104.6.eng: A number of nuns providing services for householders.

pli-tv-pvr2.1:104.8.eng: Of the six kinds of originations of offenses, it originates in two ways:

pli-tv-pvr2.1:105.1.pli: Bhikkhuniyā “ehāyye, imaṃ adhikaraṇaṃ vūpasamehī”ti vuccamānāya “sādhū”ti paṭissuṇitvā neva vūpasamentiyā na vūpasamāya ussukkaṃ karontiyā pācittiyaṃ kattha paññattanti?
pli-tv-pvr2.1:105.1.eng: “There is an offense entailing confession for agreeing, when requested by a nun, to resolve a legal issue, but then neither resolving it nor making any effort to resolve it. Where was it laid down?”

pli-tv-pvr2.1:105.6.pli: Thullanandā bhikkhunī bhikkhuniyā—“ehāyye, imaṃ adhikaraṇaṃ vūpasamehī”ti vuccamānā “sādhū”ti paṭissuṇitvā neva vūpasamesi na vūpasamāya ussukkaṃ akāsi, tasmiṃ vatthusmiṃ.
pli-tv-pvr2.1:105.6.eng: The nun Thullanandā agreeing, when asked by a nun, to resolve a legal issue, but then neither resolving it nor making any effort to resolve it.

pli-tv-pvr2.1:105.8.eng: Of the six kinds of originations of offenses, it originates in one way:

pli-tv-pvr2.1:106.1.pli: Agārikassa vā paribbājakassa vā paribbājikāya vā sahatthā khādanīyaṃ vā bhojanīyaṃ vā dentiyā pācittiyaṃ kattha paññattanti?
pli-tv-pvr2.1:106.1.eng: “There is an offense entailing confession for personally giving fresh or cooked food to a householder, a male wanderer, or a female wanderer. Where was it laid down?”

pli-tv-pvr2.1:106.6.pli: Thullanandā bhikkhunī agārikassa sahatthā khādanīyampi bhojanīyampi adāsi, tasmiṃ vatthusmiṃ.
pli-tv-pvr2.1:106.6.eng: The nun Thullanandā personally giving fresh and cooked food to a householder.

pli-tv-pvr2.1:106.8.eng: Of the six kinds of originations of offenses, it originates in two ways:

pli-tv-pvr2.1:107.1.pli: Āvasathacīvaraṃ anissajjitvā paribhuñjantiyā pācittiyaṃ kattha paññattanti?
pli-tv-pvr2.1:107.1.eng: “There is an offense entailing confession for not relinquishing but continuing to use a communal robe. Where was it laid down?”

pli-tv-pvr2.1:107.6.pli: Thullanandā bhikkhunī āvasathacīvaraṃ anissajjitvā paribhuñji, tasmiṃ vatthusmiṃ.
pli-tv-pvr2.1:107.6.eng: The nun Thullanandā not relinquishing but continuing to use a communal robe.

pli-tv-pvr2.1:107.8.eng: Of the six kinds of originations of offenses, it originates in two ways:

pli-tv-pvr2.1:107.9.eng: … (as in the rule on the robe season) …

pli-tv-pvr2.1:108.1.pli: Āvasathaṃ anissajjitvā cārikaṃ pakkamantiyā pācittiyaṃ kattha paññattanti?
pli-tv-pvr2.1:108.1.eng: “There is an offense entailing confession for going wandering without relinquishing one’s lodging. Where was it laid down?”

pli-tv-pvr2.1:108.6.pli: Thullanandā bhikkhunī āvasathaṃ anissajjitvā cārikaṃ pakkāmi, tasmiṃ vatthusmiṃ.
pli-tv-pvr2.1:108.6.eng: The nun Thullanandā going wandering without relinquishing her lodging.

pli-tv-pvr2.1:108.8.eng: Of the six kinds of originations of offenses, it originates in two ways:

pli-tv-pvr2.1:108.9.eng: … (as in the rule on the robe season) …

pli-tv-pvr2.1:109.1.eng: “There is an offense entailing confession for studying worldly subjects. Where was it laid down?”

pli-tv-pvr2.1:109.4.eng: The nuns from the group of six.

pli-tv-pvr2.1:109.6.pli: Chabbaggiyā bhikkhuniyo tiracchānavijjaṃ pariyāpuṇiṃsu, tasmiṃ vatthusmiṃ.
pli-tv-pvr2.1:109.6.eng: The nuns from the group of six studying worldly subjects.

pli-tv-pvr2.1:109.8.eng: Of the six kinds of originations of offenses, it originates in two ways:

pli-tv-pvr2.1:109.9.eng: … (as in the rule on memorizing the Teaching) …

pli-tv-pvr2.1:110.1.eng: “There is an offense entailing confession for teaching worldly subjects. Where was it laid down?”

pli-tv-pvr2.1:110.4.eng: The nuns from the group of six.

pli-tv-pvr2.1:110.6.pli: Chabbaggiyā bhikkhuniyo tiracchānavijjaṃ vācesuṃ, tasmiṃ vatthusmiṃ.
pli-tv-pvr2.1:110.6.eng: The nuns from the group of six teaching worldly subjects.

pli-tv-pvr2.1:110.8.eng: Of the six kinds of originations of offenses, it originates in two ways:

pli-tv-pvr2.1:110.9.eng: … (as in the rule on memorizing the Teaching) …

pli-tv-pvr2.1:111.1.eng: The fifth subchapter on galleries is finished.

pli-tv-pvr2.1:112.1.pli: Jānaṃ sabhikkhukaṃ ārāmaṃ anāpucchā pavisantiyā pācittiyaṃ kattha paññattanti?
pli-tv-pvr2.1:112.1.eng: “There is an offense entailing confession for entering a monastery without asking permission, yet knowing that there are monks there. Where was it laid down?”

pli-tv-pvr2.1:112.6.pli: Sambahulā bhikkhuniyo ārāmaṃ anāpucchā pavisiṃsu, tasmiṃ vatthusmiṃ.
pli-tv-pvr2.1:112.6.eng: A number of nuns entering a monastery without asking permission.

pli-tv-pvr2.1:112.7.eng: There is one rule. There are two additions to the rule.

pli-tv-pvr2.1:112.8.eng: Of the six kinds of originations of offenses, it originates in one way:

pli-tv-pvr2.1:113.1.pli: Bhikkhuṃ akkosantiyā paribhāsantiyā pācittiyaṃ kattha paññattanti?
pli-tv-pvr2.1:113.1.eng: “There is an offense entailing confession for abusing or reviling a monk. Where was it laid down?”

pli-tv-pvr2.1:113.4.eng: The nuns from the group of six.

pli-tv-pvr2.1:113.6.pli: Chabbaggiyā bhikkhuniyo āyasmantaṃ upāliṃ akkosiṃsu, tasmiṃ vatthusmiṃ.
pli-tv-pvr2.1:113.6.eng: The nuns from the group of six abusing Venerable Upāli.

pli-tv-pvr2.1:113.8.eng: Of the six kinds of originations of offenses, it originates in three ways: …

pli-tv-pvr2.1:114.1.pli: Caṇḍīkatāya gaṇaṃ paribhāsantiyā pācittiyaṃ kattha paññattanti?
pli-tv-pvr2.1:114.1.eng: “There is an offense entailing confession for furiously reviling the community. Where was it laid down?”

pli-tv-pvr2.1:114.6.pli: Thullanandā bhikkhunī caṇḍīkatāya gaṇaṃ paribhāsi, tasmiṃ vatthusmiṃ.
pli-tv-pvr2.1:114.6.eng: The nun Thullanandā furiously reviling the community.

pli-tv-pvr2.1:114.8.eng: Of the six kinds of originations of offenses, it originates in three ways: …

pli-tv-pvr2.1:115.1.pli: Nimantitāya vā pavāritāya vā khādanīyaṃ vā bhojanīyaṃ vā aññatra bhuñjantiyā pācittiyaṃ kattha paññattanti?
pli-tv-pvr2.1:115.1.eng: “There is an offense entailing confession, when invited to a meal, for refusing an offer to eat more, and then eating fresh or cooked food elsewhere. Where was it laid down?”

pli-tv-pvr2.1:115.6.pli: Sambahulā bhikkhuniyo bhuttāviniyo pavāritā aññatra bhuñjiṃsu, tasmiṃ vatthusmiṃ.
pli-tv-pvr2.1:115.6.eng: A number of nuns eating elsewhere after finishing their meal and refusing an offer to eat more.

pli-tv-pvr2.1:115.8.eng: Of the six kinds of originations of offenses, it originates in four ways: …

pli-tv-pvr2.1:116.1.eng: “There is an offense entailing confession for keeping a family to oneself. Where was it laid down?”

pli-tv-pvr2.1:116.6.pli: Aññatarā bhikkhunī kulaṃ maccharāyi, tasmiṃ vatthusmiṃ.
pli-tv-pvr2.1:116.6.eng: A certain nun keeping a family to herself.

pli-tv-pvr2.1:116.8.eng: Of the six kinds of originations of offenses, it originates in three ways: …

pli-tv-pvr2.1:117.1.pli: Abhikkhuke āvāse vassaṃ vasantiyā pācittiyaṃ kattha paññattanti?
pli-tv-pvr2.1:117.1.eng: “There is an offense entailing confession for spending the rainy-season residence in a monastery without monks. Where was it laid down?”

pli-tv-pvr2.1:117.6.pli: Sambahulā bhikkhuniyo abhikkhuke āvāse vassaṃ vasiṃsu, tasmiṃ vatthusmiṃ.
pli-tv-pvr2.1:117.6.eng: A number of nuns spending the rainy-season residence in a monastery without monks.

pli-tv-pvr2.1:117.8.eng: Of the six kinds of originations of offenses, it originates in two ways:

pli-tv-pvr2.1:118.1.pli: Vassaṃvuṭṭhāya bhikkhuniyā ubhatosaṅghe tīhi ṭhānehi na pavārentiyā pācittiyaṃ kattha paññattanti?
pli-tv-pvr2.1:118.1.eng: “There is an offense entailing confession for a nun who has completed the rainy-season residence not to invite correction from both Sanghas in regard to three things. Where was it laid down?”

pli-tv-pvr2.1:118.6.pli: Sambahulā bhikkhuniyo vassaṃvuṭṭhā bhikkhusaṅghaṃ na pavāresuṃ, tasmiṃ vatthusmiṃ.
pli-tv-pvr2.1:118.6.eng: A number of nuns who had completed the rainy-season residence not inviting the Sangha of monks for correction.

pli-tv-pvr2.1:118.8.eng: Of the six kinds of originations of offenses, it originates in one way:

pli-tv-pvr2.1:119.1.pli: Ovādāya vā saṃvāsāya vā na gacchantiyā pācittiyaṃ kattha paññattanti?
pli-tv-pvr2.1:119.1.eng: “There is an offense entailing confession for not going to the instruction or to a formal meeting of the community. Where was it laid down?”

pli-tv-pvr2.1:119.4.eng: The nuns from the group of six.

pli-tv-pvr2.1:119.6.pli: Chabbaggiyā bhikkhuniyo ovādaṃ na gacchiṃsu, tasmiṃ vatthusmiṃ.
pli-tv-pvr2.1:119.6.eng: The nuns from the group of six not going to the instruction.

pli-tv-pvr2.1:119.8.eng: Of the six kinds of originations of offenses, it originates in one way:

pli-tv-pvr2.1:119.9.eng: … (as in the first offense entailing expulsion) …

pli-tv-pvr2.1:120.1.pli: Uposathampi na pucchantiyā ovādampi na yācantiyā pācittiyaṃ kattha paññattanti?
pli-tv-pvr2.1:120.1.eng: “There is an offense entailing confession for not enquiring about the observance day nor asking for the instruction. Where was it laid down?”

pli-tv-pvr2.1:120.6.pli: Sambahulā bhikkhuniyo uposathampi na pucchiṃsu ovādampi na yāciṃsu, tasmiṃ vatthusmiṃ.
pli-tv-pvr2.1:120.6.eng: A number of nuns not enquiring about the observance day nor asking for the instruction.

pli-tv-pvr2.1:120.8.eng: Of the six kinds of originations of offenses, it originates in one way:

pli-tv-pvr2.1:121.1.pli: Pasākhe jātaṃ gaṇḍaṃ vā rudhitaṃ vā anapaloketvā saṅghaṃ vā gaṇaṃ vā purisena saddhiṃ ekenekāya bhedāpentiyā pācittiyaṃ kattha paññattanti?
pli-tv-pvr2.1:121.1.eng: “There is an offense entailing confession for being alone with a man and having him rupture an abscess or a wound situated on the lower part of one’s body, without getting permission from the Sangha or a group. Where was it laid down?”

pli-tv-pvr2.1:121.6.pli: Aññatarā bhikkhunī pasākhe jātaṃ gaṇḍaṃ purisena saddhiṃ ekenekā bhedāpesi, tasmiṃ vatthusmiṃ.
pli-tv-pvr2.1:121.6.eng: A certain nun being alone with a man and having him rupture an abscess situated on the lower part of her body.

pli-tv-pvr2.1:121.8.eng: Of the six kinds of originations of offenses, it originates in two ways:

pli-tv-pvr2.1:121.9.eng: … (as in the rule on the robe season) …

pli-tv-pvr2.1:122.1.eng: The sixth subchapter on monasteries is finished.

pli-tv-pvr2.1:123.1.eng: “There is an offense entailing confession for giving the full admission to a pregnant woman. Where was it laid down?”

pli-tv-pvr2.1:123.6.pli: Sambahulā bhikkhuniyo gabbhiniṃ vuṭṭhāpesuṃ, tasmiṃ vatthusmiṃ.
pli-tv-pvr2.1:123.6.eng: A number of nuns giving the full admission to a pregnant woman.

pli-tv-pvr2.1:123.8.eng: Of the six kinds of originations of offenses, it originates in three ways: …

pli-tv-pvr2.1:124.1.eng: “There is an offense entailing confession for giving the full admission to a woman who is breastfeeding. Where was it laid down?”

pli-tv-pvr2.1:124.6.pli: Sambahulā bhikkhuniyo pāyantiṃ vuṭṭhāpesuṃ, tasmiṃ vatthusmiṃ.
pli-tv-pvr2.1:124.6.eng: A number of nuns giving the full admission to a woman who was breastfeeding.

pli-tv-pvr2.1:124.8.eng: Of the six kinds of originations of offenses, it originates in three ways: …

pli-tv-pvr2.1:125.1.pli: Dve vassāni chasu dhammesu asikkhitasikkhaṃ sikkhamānaṃ vuṭṭhāpentiyā pācittiyaṃ kattha paññattanti?
pli-tv-pvr2.1:125.1.eng: “There is an offense entailing confession for giving the full admission to a trainee nun who has not trained for two years in the six rules. Where was it laid down?”

pli-tv-pvr2.1:125.6.pli: Sambahulā bhikkhuniyo dve vassāni chasu dhammesu asikkhitasikkhaṃ sikkhamānaṃ vuṭṭhāpesuṃ, tasmiṃ vatthusmiṃ.
pli-tv-pvr2.1:125.6.eng: A number of nuns giving the full admission to a trainee nun who had not trained for two years in the six rules.

pli-tv-pvr2.1:125.8.eng: Of the six kinds of originations of offenses, it originates in three ways: …

pli-tv-pvr2.1:126.1.pli: Dve vassāni chasu dhammesu sikkhitasikkhaṃ sikkhamānaṃ saṅghena asammataṃ vuṭṭhāpentiyā pācittiyaṃ kattha paññattanti?
pli-tv-pvr2.1:126.1.eng: “There is an offense entailing confession for giving the full admission to a trainee nun who has trained for two years in the six rules, but who has not been approved by the Sangha. Where was it laid down?”

pli-tv-pvr2.1:126.6.pli: Sambahulā bhikkhuniyo dve vassāni chasu dhammesu sikkhitasikkhaṃ sikkhamānaṃ saṅghena asammataṃ vuṭṭhāpesuṃ, tasmiṃ vatthusmiṃ.
pli-tv-pvr2.1:126.6.eng: A number of nuns giving the full admission to a trainee nun who had trained for two years in the six rules, but who had not been approved by the Sangha.

pli-tv-pvr2.1:126.8.eng: Of the six kinds of originations of offenses, it originates in three ways: …

pli-tv-pvr2.1:127.1.pli: Ūnadvādasavassaṃ gihigataṃ vuṭṭhāpentiyā pācittiyaṃ kattha paññattanti?
pli-tv-pvr2.1:127.1.eng: “There is an offense entailing confession for giving the full admission to a married girl who is less than twelve years old. Where was it laid down?”

pli-tv-pvr2.1:127.6.pli: Sambahulā bhikkhuniyo ūnadvādasavassaṃ gihigataṃ vuṭṭhāpesuṃ, tasmiṃ vatthusmiṃ.
pli-tv-pvr2.1:127.6.eng: A number of nuns giving the full admission to a married girl who was less than twelve years old.

pli-tv-pvr2.1:127.8.eng: Of the six kinds of originations of offenses, it originates in three ways: …

pli-tv-pvr2.1:128.1.pli: Paripuṇṇadvādasavassaṃ gihigataṃ dve vassāni chasu dhammesu asikkhitasikkhaṃ vuṭṭhāpentiyā pācittiyaṃ kattha paññattanti?
pli-tv-pvr2.1:128.1.eng: “There is an offense entailing confession for giving the full admission to a married girl who is more than twelve years old, but who has not trained for two years in the six rules. Where was it laid down?”

pli-tv-pvr2.1:128.6.pli: Sambahulā bhikkhuniyo paripuṇṇadvādasavassaṃ gihigataṃ dve vassāni chasu dhammesu asikkhitasikkhaṃ vuṭṭhāpesuṃ, tasmiṃ vatthusmiṃ.
pli-tv-pvr2.1:128.6.eng: A number of nuns giving the full admission to a married girl who was more than twelve years old, but who had not trained for two years in the six rules.

pli-tv-pvr2.1:128.8.eng: Of the six kinds of originations of offenses, it originates in three ways: …

pli-tv-pvr2.1:129.1.pli: Paripuṇṇadvādasavassaṃ gihigataṃ dve vassāni chasu dhammesu sikkhitasikkhaṃ saṅghena asammataṃ vuṭṭhāpentiyā pācittiyaṃ kattha paññattanti?
pli-tv-pvr2.1:129.1.eng: “There is an offense entailing confession for giving the full admission to a married girl who is more than twelve years old and who has trained for two years in the six rules, but who has not been approved by the Sangha. Where was it laid down?”

pli-tv-pvr2.1:129.6.pli: Sambahulā bhikkhuniyo paripuṇṇadvādasavassaṃ gihigataṃ dve vassāni chasu dhammesu sikkhitasikkhaṃ saṅghena asammataṃ vuṭṭhāpesuṃ, tasmiṃ vatthusmiṃ.
pli-tv-pvr2.1:129.6.eng: A number of nuns giving the full admission to a married girl who was more than twelve years old and who had trained for two years in the six rules, but who had not been approved by the Sangha.

pli-tv-pvr2.1:129.8.eng: Of the six kinds of originations of offenses, it originates in three ways: …

pli-tv-pvr2.1:130.1.pli: Sahajīviniṃ vuṭṭhāpetvā dve vassāni neva anuggaṇhantiyā na anuggaṇhāpentiyā pācittiyaṃ kattha paññattanti?
pli-tv-pvr2.1:130.1.eng: “There is an offense entailing confession for giving the full admission to a disciple, and then, for the next two years, neither guiding her nor having her guided. Where was it laid down?”

pli-tv-pvr2.1:130.6.pli: Thullanandā bhikkhunī sahajīviniṃ vuṭṭhāpetvā dve vassāni neva anuggahesi na anuggaṇhāpesi, tasmiṃ vatthusmiṃ.
pli-tv-pvr2.1:130.6.eng: The nun Thullanandā giving the full admission to a disciple, and then, for the next two years, neither guiding her nor having her guided.

pli-tv-pvr2.1:130.8.eng: Of the six kinds of originations of offenses, it originates in one way:

pli-tv-pvr2.1:131.1.pli: Vuṭṭhāpitaṃ pavattiniṃ dve vassāni nānubandhantiyā pācittiyaṃ kattha paññattanti?
pli-tv-pvr2.1:131.1.eng: “There is an offense entailing confession for not following the mentor who gave one the full admission for two years. Where was it laid down?”

pli-tv-pvr2.1:131.6.pli: Sambahulā bhikkhuniyo vuṭṭhāpitaṃ pavattiniṃ dve vassāni nānubandhiṃsu, tasmiṃ vatthusmiṃ.
pli-tv-pvr2.1:131.6.eng: A number of nuns not following the mentor who gave them the full admission for two years.

pli-tv-pvr2.1:131.8.eng: Of the six kinds of originations of offenses, it originates in one way:

pli-tv-pvr2.1:131.9.eng: … (as in the first offense entailing expulsion) …

pli-tv-pvr2.1:132.1.pli: Sahajīviniṃ vuṭṭhāpetvā neva vūpakāsentiyā na vūpakāsāpentiyā pācittiyaṃ kattha paññattanti?
pli-tv-pvr2.1:132.1.eng: “There is an offense entailing confession for giving the full admission to a disciple, and then neither sending her away nor having her sent away. Where was it laid down?”

pli-tv-pvr2.1:132.6.pli: Thullanandā bhikkhunī sahajīviniṃ vuṭṭhāpetvā neva vūpakāsesi na vūpakāsāpesi, tasmiṃ vatthusmiṃ.
pli-tv-pvr2.1:132.6.eng: The nun Thullanandā giving the full admission to a disciple, and then neither sending her away nor having her sent away.

pli-tv-pvr2.1:132.8.eng: Of the six kinds of originations of offenses, it originates in one way:

pli-tv-pvr2.1:133.1.eng: The seventh subchapter on pregnant women is finished.

pli-tv-pvr2.1:134.1.pli: Ūnavīsativassaṃ kumāribhūtaṃ vuṭṭhāpentiyā pācittiyaṃ kattha paññattanti?
pli-tv-pvr2.1:134.1.eng: “There is an offense entailing confession for giving the full admission to an unmarried woman who is less than twenty years old. Where was it laid down?”

pli-tv-pvr2.1:134.6.pli: Sambahulā bhikkhuniyo ūnavīsativassaṃ kumāribhūtaṃ vuṭṭhāpesuṃ, tasmiṃ vatthusmiṃ.
pli-tv-pvr2.1:134.6.eng: A number of nuns giving the full admission to an unmarried woman who was less than twenty years old.

pli-tv-pvr2.1:134.8.eng: Of the six kinds of originations of offenses, it originates in three ways: …

pli-tv-pvr2.1:135.1.pli: Paripuṇṇavīsativassaṃ kumāribhūtaṃ dve vassāni chasu dhammesu asikkhitasikkhaṃ vuṭṭhāpentiyā pācittiyaṃ kattha paññattanti?
pli-tv-pvr2.1:135.1.eng: “There is an offense entailing confession for giving the full admission to an unmarried woman who is more than twenty years old, but who has not trained for two years in the six rules. Where was it laid down?”

pli-tv-pvr2.1:135.6.pli: Sambahulā bhikkhuniyo paripuṇṇavīsativassaṃ kumāribhūtaṃ dve vassāni chasu dhammesu asikkhitasikkhaṃ vuṭṭhāpesuṃ, tasmiṃ vatthusmiṃ.
pli-tv-pvr2.1:135.6.eng: A number of nuns giving the full admission to an unmarried woman who was more than twenty years old, but who had not trained for two years in the six rules.

pli-tv-pvr2.1:135.8.eng: Of the six kinds of originations of offenses, it originates in three ways: …

pli-tv-pvr2.1:136.1.pli: Paripuṇṇavīsativassaṃ kumāribhūtaṃ dve vassāni chasu dhammesu sikkhitasikkhaṃ saṅghena asammataṃ vuṭṭhāpentiyā pācittiyaṃ kattha paññattanti?
pli-tv-pvr2.1:136.1.eng: “There is an offense entailing confession for giving the full admission to an unmarried woman who is more than twenty years old and who has trained for two years in the six rules, but who has not been approved by the Sangha. Where was it laid down?”

pli-tv-pvr2.1:136.6.pli: Sambahulā bhikkhuniyo paripuṇṇavīsativassaṃ kumāribhūtaṃ dve vassāni chasu dhammesu sikkhitasikkhaṃ saṅghena asammataṃ vuṭṭhāpesuṃ, tasmiṃ vatthusmiṃ.
pli-tv-pvr2.1:136.6.eng: A number of nuns giving the full admission to an unmarried woman who was more than twenty years old and who had trained for two years in the six rules, but who had not been approved by the Sangha.

pli-tv-pvr2.1:136.8.eng: Of the six kinds of originations of offenses, it originates in three ways: …

pli-tv-pvr2.1:137.1.eng: “There is an offense entailing confession for one who has less than twelve years of seniority giving the full admission. Where was it laid down?”

pli-tv-pvr2.1:137.6.pli: Sambahulā bhikkhuniyo ūnadvādasavassā vuṭṭhāpesuṃ, tasmiṃ vatthusmiṃ.
pli-tv-pvr2.1:137.6.eng: A number of nuns who had less than twelve years of seniority giving the full admission.

pli-tv-pvr2.1:137.8.eng: Of the six kinds of originations of offenses, it originates in three ways: …

pli-tv-pvr2.1:138.1.pli: Paripuṇṇadvādasavassāya saṅghena asammatāya vuṭṭhāpentiyā pācittiyaṃ kattha paññattanti?
pli-tv-pvr2.1:138.1.eng: “There is an offense entailing confession for one who has twelve years of seniority giving the full admission without approval from the Sangha. Where was it laid down?”

pli-tv-pvr2.1:138.6.pli: Sambahulā bhikkhuniyo paripuṇṇadvādasavassā saṅghena asammatā vuṭṭhāpesuṃ, tasmiṃ vatthusmiṃ.
pli-tv-pvr2.1:138.6.eng: A number of nuns who had twelve years of seniority giving the full admission without approval from the Sangha.

pli-tv-pvr2.1:138.8.eng: Of the six kinds of originations of offenses, it originates in three ways:

pli-tv-pvr2.1:138.9.eng: … (as in the second offense entailing expulsion) …

pli-tv-pvr2.1:139.1.pli: “Alaṃ tāva te, ayye, vuṭṭhāpitenā”ti vuccamānāya “sādhū”ti paṭissuṇitvā pacchā khīyanadhammaṃ āpajjantiyā pācittiyaṃ kattha paññattanti?
pli-tv-pvr2.1:139.1.eng: “There is an offense entailing confession for verbally consenting when being told, ‘Venerable, you’ve given enough full admissions for now,’ but then criticizing it afterwards. Where was it laid down?”

pli-tv-pvr2.1:139.6.pli: Caṇḍakāḷī bhikkhunī “alaṃ tāva te, ayye, vuṭṭhāpitenā”ti vuccamānā “sādhū”ti paṭissuṇitvā pacchā khīyanadhammaṃ āpajji, tasmiṃ vatthusmiṃ.
pli-tv-pvr2.1:139.6.eng: The nun Caṇḍakālī verbally consenting when being told, “Venerable, you’ve given enough full admissions for now,” but then criticizing it afterwards.

pli-tv-pvr2.1:139.8.eng: Of the six kinds of originations of offenses, it originates in three ways: …

pli-tv-pvr2.1:140.1.pli: Sikkhamānaṃ—“sace me tvaṃ, ayye, cīvaraṃ dassasi, evāhaṃ taṃ vuṭṭhāpessāmī”ti vatvā neva vuṭṭhāpentiyā na vuṭṭhāpanāya ussukkaṃ karontiyā pācittiyaṃ kattha paññattanti?
pli-tv-pvr2.1:140.1.eng: “There is an offense entailing confession for telling a trainee nun, ‘If you give me a robe, venerable, I’ll give you the full admission,’ but then neither giving her the full admission nor making any effort to have her fully admitted. Where was it laid down?”

pli-tv-pvr2.1:140.6.pli: Thullanandā bhikkhunī sikkhamānaṃ—“sace me tvaṃ, ayye, cīvaraṃ dassasi, evāhaṃ taṃ vuṭṭhāpessāmī”ti vatvā neva vuṭṭhāpesi na vuṭṭhāpanāya ussukkaṃ akāsi, tasmiṃ vatthusmiṃ.
pli-tv-pvr2.1:140.6.eng: The nun Thullanandā telling a trainee nun, “If you give me a robe, venerable, I’ll give you the full admission,” but then neither giving her the full admission nor making any effort to have her fully admitted.

pli-tv-pvr2.1:140.8.eng: Of the six kinds of originations of offenses, it originates in one way:

pli-tv-pvr2.1:141.1.pli: Sikkhamānaṃ—“sace maṃ tvaṃ, ayye, dve vassāni anubandhissasi, evāhaṃ taṃ vuṭṭhāpessāmī”ti vatvā neva vuṭṭhāpentiyā na vuṭṭhāpanāya ussukkaṃ karontiyā pācittiyaṃ kattha paññattanti?
pli-tv-pvr2.1:141.1.eng: “There is an offense entailing confession for telling a trainee nun, ‘If you follow me for two years, Venerable, I’ll give you the full admission,’ but then neither giving her the full admission nor making any effort to have her fully admitted. Where was it laid down?”

pli-tv-pvr2.1:141.6.pli: Thullanandā bhikkhunī sikkhamānaṃ—“sace maṃ tvaṃ, ayye, dve vassāni anubandhissasi, evāhaṃ taṃ vuṭṭhāpessāmī”ti vatvā neva vuṭṭhāpesi na vuṭṭhāpanāya ussukkaṃ akāsi, tasmiṃ vatthusmiṃ.
pli-tv-pvr2.1:141.6.eng: The nun Thullanandā telling a trainee nun, “If you follow me for two years, venerable, I’ll give you the full admission,” but then neither giving her the full admission nor making any effort to have her fully admitted.

pli-tv-pvr2.1:141.8.eng: Of the six kinds of originations of offenses, it originates in one way:

pli-tv-pvr2.1:142.1.pli: Purisasaṃsaṭṭhaṃ kumārakasaṃsaṭṭhaṃ caṇḍiṃ sokāvāsaṃ sikkhamānaṃ vuṭṭhāpentiyā pācittiyaṃ kattha paññattanti?
pli-tv-pvr2.1:142.1.eng: “There is an offense entailing confession for giving the full admission to a trainee nun who is socializing with men and boys and who is temperamental and difficult to live with. Where was it laid down?”

pli-tv-pvr2.1:142.6.pli: Thullanandā bhikkhunī purisasaṃsaṭṭhaṃ kumārakasaṃsaṭṭhaṃ caṇḍiṃ sokāvāsaṃ sikkhamānaṃ vuṭṭhāpesi, tasmiṃ vatthusmiṃ.
pli-tv-pvr2.1:142.6.eng: The nun Thullanandā giving the full admission to a trainee nun who was socializing with men and boys and who was temperamental and difficult to live with.

pli-tv-pvr2.1:142.8.eng: Of the six kinds of originations of offenses, it originates in three ways: …

pli-tv-pvr2.1:143.1.pli: Mātāpitūhi vā sāmikena vā ananuññātaṃ sikkhamānaṃ vuṭṭhāpentiyā pācittiyaṃ kattha paññattanti?
pli-tv-pvr2.1:143.1.eng: “There is an offense entailing confession for giving the full admission to a trainee nun who has not been given permission by her parents or her husband. Where was it laid down?”

pli-tv-pvr2.1:143.6.pli: Thullanandā bhikkhunī mātāpitūhipi sāmikenāpi ananuññātaṃ sikkhamānaṃ vuṭṭhāpesi, tasmiṃ vatthusmiṃ.
pli-tv-pvr2.1:143.6.eng: The nun Thullanandā giving the full admission to a trainee nun who had not been given permission by her parents and her husband.
